meta.name: Ages Unwound
meta.description: An adventure through time. Cultists and also dinosaurs. Maybe cultists riding dinosaurs? (No. Sorry.)
meta.author: Olivia Juliet

cards.name: Night of Fire
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is half the number of locations in the Arkham Streets deck (rounded down).
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, after this test ends, move to a new Arkham Streets location.
[tablet]: –3 (–1 instead if you have moved this turn).

cards.name: Night of Fire
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of locations in the Arkham Streets deck.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, after this test ends, move to a new Arkham Streets location.
[tablet]: –4 (–2 instead if you have moved this turn).

cards.flavor: Why are you being pursued by people with guns? Hard to say. There must be some reason, but you're currently without much time to think.
cards.name: Hunted
cards.text: Doom on cards other than this agenda subtracts from the total doom in play instead of adding to it. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you did not move at least once during your turn: Test [agility] (2). If you fail, take 1 damage. Objective - Survive the night.

cards.name: Something Unnatural
cards.text:
A shiver runs down your spine. You're being watched. You glance furtively around you, but spot no sign of your pursuers. Until, that is, your eyes catch a strange, furred, creature moving in the shadows. Something stranger than men with guns is pursuing you this night...
For each investigator, spawn a set-aside copy of Time Spirit engaged with that investigator unless the investigators spend 2 clues as a group. Shuffle Myriad Assassin, Irregulars and the Agents of Aforgomon encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Advance to act 2a and agenda 2a.

cards.flavor: You're starting to get your bearings, though you don't know what's after you, or why. Whatever it is, it's not human.
cards.name: Watched
cards.text: Doom on cards other than this agenda subtracts from the total doom in play instead of adding to it. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you did not move at least once during your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage. Objective - Survive the night.

cards.name: Sentinel
cards.text:
Your legs ache, your lungs burn, but for a moment all is quiet. You strive to catch your breath, revering the brief moment of peace. All too soon, a figure glides out of the shadows nearby. Tall, furred, with slender limbs held at impossible angles. Its gaze locks onto your soul, filling you with a cold sense of dread. Itsees you.
If it is act 2, spawn the set-aside Eternity's Sentinel (Scourge in the Shadows) at a new Arkham Streets location. (If no such locations exist, spawn it at Rivertown instead.) Otherwise, spawn the set-aside Eternity's Sentinel (Watcher of the Ages) at the lead investigator's location.

cards.flavor: You don't know what the thing is that's chasing you. You don't want to know. You just keep going.
cards.name: Gaze of Three Eyes
cards.text: Doom on cards other than this agenda subtracts from the total doom in play instead of adding to it. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you did not move at least once during your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, choose two of: spend a clue, take 1 damage and take 1 horror. Objective - Survive the night.

cards.name: Morning Breaks
cards.text:
Finally, beautifully, sunrise.
→R2.

cards.flavor: It seems like nowhere is safe. The streets are empty, law or sanity nowhere to be seen. All you can do is keep moving and pray for the light of morning.
cards.name: On the Lam
cards.text: [reaction] When an effect (including a move action) would allow you to move to a connecting location: Instead, move to a new Arkham Streets location. (You may initiate a move even if there are no connecting locations in play.) Forced - At the end of the round: Shuffle each empty location into the Arkham Streets deck. Objective - Run! (Do not advance until you are instructed.)

cards.name: Lost in Darkness
cards.text:
How did... how did you even get here? These streets all look the same. You think you've been here before, but it's so hard to tell, in the dark and the cold, and... A rattle of gunfire a few streets away snaps your mind back to the present. You continue on.
Flip back to act 1a.

cards.flavor: At first, the streets all look the same, but as your eyes start growing accustomed to the dark you start picking out more details. Maybe you can figure out exactly where you are...
cards.name: Getting Your Bearings
cards.text: [reaction] When an effect would allow you to move to a connecting location: Instead, move to a new Arkham Streets location. Forced - At the end of the round: Shuffle each empty location without a resource on into the Arkham Streets deck. [free] Investigators at your location spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place a resource on your location (from the token pool). Objective - If there are 8 [[Arkham]] locations in play and each location in play has a resource on it, advance.

cards.name: A Way Out?
cards.text:
The men chasing you have ringed off several blocks, turning you back with a hail of gunfire whenever you approach their perimeter. Though, maybe there's a path they've missed?
Place 1[per_investigator] clues on each of A Place to Hide, Winchmore House and Cramped Passage. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Hired Thugs and spawn them at Winchmore House. For the remainder of the scenario, this enemy gets +1[per_investigator] health and loses hunter. If Eternity's Sentinel (Scourge in the Shadows) is in play, replace it with the set-aside Eternity's Sentinel (Watcher of the Ages) (it keeps all tokens and attachments). Then, if it is in play but at no location, spawn it at Rivertown.

cards.flavor: There must be a way out of this trap. And if there isn't, you must be able to make one...
cards.name: Slipping the Net
cards.text: Each location gets +1 shroud. Objective - If there are no clues on A Place to Hide, Winchmore House and Cramped Passage, advance.

cards.name: Sweet Freedom
cards.text:
There's a winding passage near Easttown that could get you out. A distraction outside Winchmore House is enough to get a bunch of your pursuers out of your way, and a few choice bits of evidence lead them straight to your rotting hideout. Which, naturally, is abandoned, as you flee through the far side of their perimeter.
→R4.

cards.flavor:
One light burns brightly in the smothering darkness. 
It's one you'd rather not look at.
cards.name: Rivertown
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are in Rivertown: Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, take 1 horror. [action] Discard a [[Darkness]] treachery card at this location or next to the agenda deck.

cards.flavor: It's easy to get lost at night in the twisting streets of Arkham, especially when you're running for your life.
cards.name: Arkham Streets

cards.flavor: There's nowhere left to run.
cards.name: Independence Square
cards.text: Forced - When an investigator at this location initiates a skill test printed on an act/agenda card: Increase the difficulty of this skill test by 2.

cards.flavor: It's easy to get lost at night in the twisting streets of Arkham, especially when you're running for your life.
cards.name: Arkham Streets
Easttown
cards.text: While you are in Easttown, reduce the cost of each [[Ally]] asset you play by 2 and increase the cost of each other asset you play by 1. [action] Discard an asset you control: Gain 2 clues (from the token pool).(Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: It's easy to get lost at night in the twisting streets of Arkham, especially when you're running for your life.
cards.name: Arkham Streets

cards.flavor: One of the richest and most historical neighborhoods in Arkham, the many decaying mansions and estates of French Hill hold a lot of old wealth... and many more secrets.
cards.name: French Hill
cards.text: While investigating French Hill during your turn, if you did not start your turn here, it gets –3 shroud.

cards.flavor: It's easy to get lost at night in the twisting streets of Arkham, especially when you're running for your life.
cards.name: Arkham Streets
Twisting Alleys
cards.text: Forced - When you would leave Twisting Alleys, if you are not moving to a new Arkham Streets location: Test [willpower] or [agility] (3). If you fail, move to a new Arkham Streets location instead of your original destination. If no such locations exist, instead cancel the effects of the move.

cards.flavor: It's easy to get lost at night in the twisting streets of Arkham, especially when you're running for your life.
cards.name: Arkham Streets
Winchmore House
cards.text:
While there is a ready enemy at Winchmore House, investigators here cannot move except by the below ability.
Enemies at this location get +1 fight and +1 evade.
[action] Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand: Disengage from each enemy engaged with you and move to a connecting location.

cards.flavor: It's easy to get lost at night in the twisting streets of Arkham, especially when you're running for your life.
cards.name: Arkham Streets
Cramped Passage
cards.text: No more than one investigator may be in Cramped Passage at a time. Forced - After you enter Cramped Passage: Place 1 clue on Cramped Passage (from the token pool).

cards.flavor: It's easy to get lost at night in the twisting streets of Arkham, especially when you're running for your life.
cards.name: Arkham Streets

cards.flavor:
"Maybe we could just... just stay here. 
Maybe they won't find us here."
cards.name: A Place to Hide
cards.text: Forced - When an investigator at this location initiates a skill test printed on an agenda card: That investigator automatically succeeds.

cards.flavor: It's easy to get lost at night in the twisting streets of Arkham, especially when you're running for your life.
cards.name: Arkham Streets
Eternity's Sentinel
cards.text: Hunter. Cannot be damaged. Forced - After Eternity's Sentinel attacks: Place it next to the Arkham Streets deck (it is still in play, but at no location). After a new Arkham Streets location is put into play, place Eternity's Sentinel at that location. Forced - At the end of the round, if Eternity's Sentinel is at no location: Place 1 doom on Eternity's Sentinel.

cards.name: Eternity's Sentinel
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Eternity's Sentinel is ready and unengaged, and there is an investigator at Eternity's Sentinel's location: Place 1 doom on Eternity's Sentinel. Objective - If Eternity's Sentinel is defeated: (→R3)

cards.flavor:
Moments live and die just like the rest of us, 
and sometimes, occasionally, they leave ghosts...
cards.name: Time Spirit
cards.text: Forced - After you defeat Time Spirit: Gain an action.

cards.flavor: Everything burns, given the right kindling.
cards.name: Arsonists
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Arsonists are ready and unengaged: Each investigator at Arsonists' location takes 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.name: In Every Shadow
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Test [agility] (4). This test gets +1 difficulty for every 2 cards in the Arkham Streets deck. For each point you fail by, discard the top card of the encounter deck. Draw a [[Criminal]] enemy and a [[Darkness]] treachery discarded this way.

cards.flavor: "Nothing personal, kid. I just do what I'm paid to."
cards.name: Just Business
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 2 horror and move to a new Arkham Streets location.

cards.name: Sheer Exhaustion
cards.text: Revelation - Put Sheer Exhaustion into play in your threat area. You cannot draw cards or gain resources during the upkeep phase. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you have not moved this round: Discard Sheer Exhaustion.

cards.name: The Myriad Gentleman
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1 (–3 instead if there is a [[Myriad]] enemy at your location).
[cultist]: –1. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to a [[Myriad]] enemy at your location.
[tablet]: –2. If you fail and it is Act 2 or 3, spawn a copy of The Myriad Gentleman engaged with you.

cards.name: The Myriad Gentleman
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2 (–4 instead if there is a [[Myriad]] enemy at your location).
[cultist]: –3. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to a [[Myriad]] enemy at your location.
[tablet]: –3. After this test ends, if it is Act 2 or 3, spawn a copy of The Myriad Gentleman engaged with you.

cards.flavor: Something about this place sets you on edge. The air shimmers in places, like on a hot day, and when you step too close to these disturbances, you feel... different. Like you're stepping off a moving train.
cards.name: Ripples in Reality
Baxter Manor Beckons
cards.text:
If it is act 1:
A fine manor house towers over the estate. You spend some time seeking a way inside, though attempts at subtlety are rendered moot as the front door simply opens, and a man ambles out to meet you.
Each investigator loses each of their clues. Remember that "he is ready for you." Advance to act 1b.
If it is act 2 or 3:
The situation is absurd, and yet you can't deny its truth: A thousand copies of Joseph Baxter stalk you throughout his estate, separate and yet moving in coordination, like one fluid whole. If you don't move quickly, you're likely to be overwhelmed.
Spawn a copy of The Myriad Gentleman engaged with each investigator.

cards.flavor: As the Myriad Gentleman pursues you, reality continues to shimmer and shift. You step through patches of impossibility, finding yourself riddled with a thousand subtle changes.
cards.name: Army of One
Timequake
cards.text:
Something echoes outwards from the house's heart, something like a sound but which bypasses your ears and pierces your soul. Your head spins, muddled with thoughts that are not yours.
Each investigator must either take 2 horror or choose and discard 3 cards from their hand. Each player searches the top 6 cards of another player's deck for 2 non-weakness, non-signature cards and draws them, then shuffles the searched deck.

cards.flavor: There are too many of them. He's everywhere.
cards.name: From One, Many
cards.text: Each [[Myriad]] treachery gains surge.

cards.name: Overwhelmed
cards.text:
You don't know where they're coming from, or how many there are. You just know that there are far far, too many for you to deal with.
Each remaining investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.

cards.flavor: You try to clear your head and focus on the task at hand. Joseph Baxter, the man who owns this house, arranged for you to be killed. You'd rather like to find out why.
cards.name: A Fine Country Garden
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, the investigators may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: A Peculiar Fellow
cards.text:
As you explore the manor's garden, a tall man in a fine suit strolls out to meet you, seemingly unconcerned at you ransacking his property. "A shame," he sighs. "You just can't get the staff these days." You try to ask him why he'd plotted your demise, but he cuts you off. "No, no, no time for that. It's too close now, there's nothing for it. I'm going to have to finish you off myself." He draws a dagger and advances on you.
Place the set-aside The Myriad Gentleman (Thousandfold Man) next to the agenda. This card is not in play. Each investigator spawns a copy ofThe Myriad Gentleman, engaged with them. If "he is ready for you", the lead investigator spawns 1[per_investigator] copies ofThe Myriad Gentleman engaged with them. Put each set-aside location into play. Shuffle each set-aside [[Myriad]] treachery into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile.

cards.flavor: As the figure advances on you, you spy others nearer to the house. Two more men in fine suits, tall- They're him. They're both him. How is that even possible?
cards.name: Just One Man
cards.text: Forced - When a treachery card would search, reveal or discard from the encounter deck to find an enemy: Instead spawn a copy of The Myriad Gentleman, treating it as having been found by that treachery. Objective - At the end of the round, investigators at the Landing may spend the requisite number of clues to advance.

cards.name: First Amongst Equals
cards.text:
You've found all kinds of documents around this awful manor. References to a ritual, a unification, happening tonight. Mentions of this man, Joseph Baxter, the Myriad Gentleman, and a boon granted by a being known as Aforgomon. Finally, you find a heavy brass key in a hidden drawer. It opens the door to the manor's study with a low creak. Inside, you find the man, again, though this time he's prying an ornate sword off of the wall. "If you want something doing," he says, smiling slightly at his sort-of joke.
Reveal the Study. Spawn the set-aside The Myriad Gentleman (Master of the House) and 1[per_investigator] copies of The Myriad Gentleman (Thousandfold Man) at the Study.

cards.flavor: This man is dangerous, and whatever ritual he's involved in, it probably isn't good. You hope his study will hold the details you are missing.
cards.name: Swarmed
cards.text: Forced - When a treachery card would search, reveal or discard from the encounter deck to find an enemy: Instead spawn a copy of The Myriad Gentleman, treating it as having been found by that treachery. Objective - Investigators in the Study may spend the requisite number of clues to advance.

cards.name: All Times as One
cards.text:
You have a location—a run-down elementary school near Southside. You also found, though you rather wish you hadn't, a description of the ritual's purpose: "To make all times as one, to reforge time itself, for the glory of great Aforgomon." That does not sound good.
→R1.

cards.flavor: This wide, sweeping green space is perfectly manicured. You'd say it had been recently cut, but there's no sign of stray clippings or other detritus. It's a little too perfect...
cards.name: Lawn
cards.text: [action]: Resign. Coming here was a bad idea.

cards.flavor: Breaking and entering isn't what you imagined you'd be doing yesterday, but a lot can change in 24 hours.
cards.name: Lawn
Hedge Maze
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, place 1 resource on Hedge Maze (from the token pool). Forced - When you would leave Hedge Maze, if there is at least 1 resource on it: Remove 1 resource from Hedge Maze and cancel the effects of the move.

cards.flavor:
Tall hedgerows stand wild and untamed, 
beckoning you ever inwards.
cards.name: Hedge Maze

cards.flavor: Don't drink the water.
cards.name: Ornate Fountain
cards.text: [action]: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
This sculptured fountain looks innocuous enough. 
It's only on closer inspection that you spot 
that its waters are flowing upwards.
cards.name: Ornate Fountain

cards.flavor:
The interior of this building looks like 
it's been abandoned for a very long time. 
And yet, the manure piled around the place is still fresh.
cards.name: Stables
cards.text: The Stables are investigated using [combat] instead of the skill indicated by the investigation attempt.

cards.flavor: This rickety old building looks rather out of place in the midst of such an obsessively-kept estate.
cards.name: Stables
Entrance Hall
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Entrance Hall: At the end of the current round, spawn 1[per_investigator] copies of The Myriad Gentleman at Entrance Hall. This is my home, child. My fortress. Do you really think you can confront me here?

cards.flavor:
A pair of double doors hangs ajar, allowing you 
entrance to the manor. Whether or not such a thing is advisable, well, that's another matter entirely.
cards.name: Entrance Hall

cards.flavor: Violet light filters into the room, cast by a sun just dipping below the horizon. This despite it being the middle of the day...
cards.name: Parlor
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Parlor: Spawn 1[per_investigator] copies of The Myriad Gentleman at Parlor. Unengaged enemies at Parlor do not automatically engage investigators who did not begin the round at Parlor.

cards.flavor:
This room stretches out before you, far longer than 
the size of the house would seem to allow.
cards.name: Parlor

cards.flavor:
Several large vats bubble away, filled with a dark, 
tar-like substance. There's no actual food in sight.
cards.name: Kitchen
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Kitchen: Spawn 2 copies of The Myriad Gentleman at Kitchen. [action] Test [willpower] (3). For each point you succeed by, defeat a copy of The Myriad Gentleman at Kitchen. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor:
A small side door leads further into the mansion. 
The smell of blood is strongest this way.
cards.name: Kitchen
Landing
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Landing, if there are at least 3 players in the game: Spawn 2 copies of The Myriad Gentleman at Landing. [reaction] When you activate a Fight ability on a [[Ranged, Firearm]] or [[Spell]] card: This attack targets an enemy in the Entrance Hall. Ignore the aloof and retaliate keywords for this attack.

cards.flavor:
Richly carpeted stairs lead up to a second floor. 
They creak and moan as you climb them, 
as if victims of hundreds of years of wear.
cards.name: Landing
Master Bedroom
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while at Master Bedroom: Spawn 1 copy of The Myriad Gentleman engaged with you. [reaction] After you successfully investigate Master Bedroom: Automatically evade a copy of The Myriad Gentlemen at Master Bedroom.

cards.name: Master Bedroom
Study
cards.text: While at least one investigator is at Study, each copy of The Myriad Gentleman gains "Patrol (Study)." Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at Study spawns a copy of The Myriad Gentleman at Entrance Hall.

cards.flavor: An ornate locked door stands at the top of the stairs.
cards.name: Study
cards.text: The door to this room is locked. You may not enter the Study.

cards.name: Gaze of Aforgomon
cards.text: Revelation - Put Gaze of Aforgomon into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you have taken at least 4 actions this turn: Place 1 resource on Gaze of Aforgomon, as an offering. [action][action]: Place 1 resource on Gaze of Aforgomon, as an offering. Forced - At the end of the game, if Gaze of Aforgomon has fewer than 4 offerings on it: You suffer 1 physical trauma.

cards.name: Aforgomon's Blade
cards.text: Uses (3 charges). [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed, you may spend 1 charge and exhaust Aforgomon's Blade to gain 1 action and give the attacked enemy –1 fight and –1 evade until the end of the round.

cards.name: The Myriad Gentleman
cards.text:
While there are at least 2 other ready [[Myriad]] enemies at his location, The Myriad Gentleman gets +1 fight.
When The Myriad Gentleman is defeated, any excess damage may be dealt to other copies of this enemy at its location.
[reaction] After you successfully evade The Myriad Gentleman: For each point you succeeded by, you may evade a copy of this enemy engaged with you.

cards.name: The Myriad Gentleman
cards.text: The Myriad Gentleman cannot leave Study. Forced - When The Myriad Gentleman attacks during the enemy phase: Instead of its standard damage and horror, it deals X damage and/or horror, where X is the number of [[Myriad]] enemies in play (max 5).

cards.name: Ex Uno Plures
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, spawn a copy of The Myriad Gentleman engaged with you.

cards.name: They Just Keep Coming
cards.text: Revelation - Spawn a copy of The Myriad Gentleman in each of the following locations, if they are revealed: the Entrance Hall, the Landing and the Study. If no enemies are spawned this way, They Just Keep Coming gains surge.

cards.name: Not Welcome Here
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Choose an investigator. Move each [[Myriad]] enemy in play once towards the chosen investigator. Spawn copies of The Myriad Gentleman engaged with that investigator until they are engaged with at least 3 [[Myriad]] enemies.

cards.name: Fragmented Existence
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 2 damage. If you succeed and there is no copy of Fragmented Existence in your threat area, put Fragmented Existence into play in your threat area. [action] If Fragmented Existence is in your threat area, discard it: Evade. Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Then, automatically evade each enemy engaged with you.

cards.name: A World Torn Down
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is half the number of actions you have remaining (rounded up).
[cultist]: –3. If you succeed, you get +1 skill value during skill tests until the end of the round.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, you get –1 skill value during skill tests until the end of the round.
[elder_thing]: Reveal another token. If you fail and it is your turn, end your turn.

cards.name: A World Torn Down
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of actions you have remaining.
[cultist]: –5. If you succeed, you get +1 skill value during skill tests until the end of the round.
[tablet]: –5. If you fail, you get –1 skill value during skill tests until the end of the round.
[elder_thing]: Reveal another token. If it is your turn, end your turn after resolving this skill test.

cards.flavor: A shimmering green barrier surrounds Mount Hollyoke Elementary School, malignant and forbidding. From within, faint sounds of chanting emanate, and time around the school starts to shiver and convulse.
cards.name: The Ritual Begins
cards.text: [action]: Call out for assistance, and hope your benefactor is listening. Draw the set-aside Aid From Afar story card and resolve its text.

cards.name: Time Breaking Slowly
cards.text:
Time stretches out ever longer, then snaps together in unfamiliar configurations. The ritual progresses, and chronology is becoming unstuck...
Each investigator tests [willpower] (4). Each investigator who succeeds gains an action. Each investigator who fails by 3 or more loses an action. Choose an unengaged, non-weakness, non-[[Elite]] enemy (not a swarm card). Remove that enemy from the game. Then, record in your Campaign Log that [the chosen enemy] disappeared unexpectedly. For the remainder of the game, the current agenda gains: "[action]: Call out for assistance, and hope your benefactor is listening. Draw the set-aside Aid From Afar story card and resolve its text." Place this card next to the agenda deck as a reminder, then advance to agenda 2a.

cards.flavor: The Myriad are here in force. As the very fabric of your existence wears thin, the Gentleman and the creatures that serve him stand against you in ever greater numbers.
cards.name: Time Running Out
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you have any standard actions remaining: You gain 1 action for the next round.

cards.name: Chaos Temporalis
cards.text:
Time is running out, or running together, or simply falling apart. Nothing around you is stable. Ancient things become new and effect precedes cause. How much longer do you have before you too succumb to time?
Each investigator reveals a random token from the chaos bag. -Each investigator who reveals a symbol loses 1 action and gets +1 skill value during skill tests until the end of the round. -Each other investigator gains 1 action and gets –1 skill value during skill tests until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: As the ritual reaches a crescendo, you feel the days of your life stacked up against one another. You can see your past, even glimpses of days yet to come, and through all of them the terrible gaze of Aforgomon's three eyes. It seems to mock you as your minutes merge and twist together.
cards.name: End of the Line
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you have any standard actions remaining: You gain actions for the next round equal to the number you have remaining (to a maximum of 3).

cards.name: Time Shatters
cards.text:
And just like that, time falls apart.
Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: Someone has to stop what's happening here, and no-one else seems to be volunteering. Step one is getting past the Myriad's warding and into the school...
cards.name: The Boundary
cards.text: Objective - If an investigator enters an [[Interior]] location, advance.

cards.name: Breaking the Boundary
cards.text:
Preparing the components you've gathered and uttering an incantation, you step into the barrier, parting it wide enough to allow you passage.
In your Campaign Log, record that the boundary is broken. Next to this, record the time.
If you advanced by entering the Front Hallway:
As you step through the school's front doors, you are stopped in your tracks by the sight of a colossal, slumbering beast blocking your path.
In your Campaign Log, record that the investigators used the school's front door. Remove Rear Corridors from the game. Put the set-aside Cafeteria and Principal's Office locations into play. Spawn the set-aside Hound of Unmaking at the Front Hallway. Shuffle each set-aside copy of Stirring Titan into the encounter deck. Advance to Act 2a – Big and Ugly.
If you advanced by entering the Rear Corridors:
You slip into the school through the back and spot a door at the end of the hall wrapped in purplish energy.
In your Campaign Log, record that the investigators snuck into the back of the school. Remove Front Hallway from the game. Put each of the set-aside Classroom locations into play. Attach the set-aside Unstable Warding story asset to Rear Corridors. Advance to Act 2a – Doorway to the Unknown.

cards.flavor: The monster standing in your way would be utterly terrifying were it not asleep. As it is, still pretty terrifying. You could try fighting it, but it might be easier to try and scare it off...
cards.name: Big and Ugly
cards.text: Whilst the Hound of Unmaking is undamaged, it cannot make attacks. Objective - Investigators may spend the requisite number of clues to advance. Objective - If the Hound of Unmaking is defeated, advance.

cards.name: Physical Education
cards.text:
If you spent clues to advance:
You augment the school bell with some of the ritual components you've gathered from around the school. It lets out a piercing screech, startling the Hound and sending it bounding away towards the back of the school.
In your Campaign Log, record that the investigators repelled the Hound of Unmaking. Next to this, record the time and the amount of damage on the Hound of Unmaking. Remove the Hound of Unmaking from the game.
If you defeated the Hound of Unmaking:
The beast lets out a haunting wail, and the whole corridor shakes as its form collapses to the ground. You let out a breath you didn't realise you were holding, and get to work moving the immense body out of your way.
In your Campaign Log, record that the investigators put down the Hound of Unmaking. Next to this, record the time.
However you advanced: Put the set aside Ritual Circle (Gateway to the Past) location into play. Advance to Act 3a – Breaking the Circle.

cards.flavor: The door at the end of the hall crackles with energy that pulses and flows erratically. Much as you'd rather not touch it, that door must lead to where you need to be.
cards.name: Doorway to the Unknown
cards.text: Objective - If there are 4 resources on Unstable Warding, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Myriad Encounters
cards.text:
If there are 4 resources on Unstable Warding:
The ward is powerful, the energy crackling through it enough to power a small city. Nevertheless, you manage to disrupt its flow, grounding the magic and allowing you passage.
In your Campaign Log, record that the investigators dispelled the ward. Next to this, record the time. Remove Unstable Warding from the game.
If the investigators unleashed chaos:
The energy of the broken ward ripples out, disturbing and destabilising the Myriad's ritual.
Place 4[per_investigator] clues on Ritual Circle (A Harnessed Future) as it enters play. Then, remove 1[per_investigator] clues from Ritual Circle (A Harnessed Future) for each resource on Unstable Warding.
However you advanced:
You step through the now unprotected doorway and find yourself face to face, once again, with the Myriad Gentleman. Wearing decadent ceremonial robes, he assumes a defensive stance, drawing sigils in the air before him.
Put the set aside Ritual Circle (A Harnessed Future) into play. Spawn the set aside The Myriad Gentleman (The High Priest) at the Ritual Circle. Advance to Act 3a – Breaking the Circle.

cards.flavor: The school hall has been transformed—three huge ritual circles cover most of the floor, crackling with energy. Flashes of other times assault your senses. You have to break this circle before it is too late.
cards.name: Breaking the Circle
cards.text: Objective - If Ritual Circle has no clues on it, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Glimpse of Things to Come
cards.text:
Fighting past the cultists guarding the circle, you seize a passing moment and use it to disrupt the flow of temporal energies. The backlash is immense—as the circle slowly shatters, fragments of history explode out at you. You weather the storm, turning towards the other two circles.
In your Campaign Log, record that the investigators broke the first circle. Next to this, record the time. (→R3).

cards.flavor:
Inside the school grounds, time twists and roils. 
A reminder that an escape is possible is welcome, even if you know you have little choice but to stay.
cards.name: Front Gates
cards.text: [action][action]: Discard a [[Terror]] treachery in your threat area.

cards.flavor:
The gates to Mount Hollyoke Elementary 
stand ajar, as if inviting you in.
cards.name: Front Gates

cards.flavor:
Full of cramped classrooms and winding corridors, 
the building is a veritable maze.
cards.name: Side Building
cards.text: This location's shroud cannot be reduced. Forced - After you successfully investigate Side Building: Side Building gets +1 shroud until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: The barrier around the school only protects its main building. A ramshackle secondary structure stands within your reach, looking ready to collapse at any moment.
cards.name: Side Building
Children's Playground
cards.text: [reaction] When an investigator initiates an investigation of Children's Playground, spend X actions: Children's Playground gets –X shroud for this investigation.

cards.flavor: The old, rickety equipment has been worn down by years of play. Several children's handprints have been stained into the woodwork with a deep red pigment.
cards.name: Children's Playground

cards.flavor:
An expanse of green sits behind the school, 
weeds pushing up through the once-pristine grass.
cards.name: Sports Field
cards.text: [reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more while investigating Sports Field: Heal 1 horror. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
An expanse of green sits behind the school, 
weeds pushing up through the once-pristine grass.
cards.name: Sports Field
Aid from Afar
cards.text:
You call out into empty air, feeling faintly foolish. Still, they've seemed to know when you've needed help before. Silence hangs for a moment, then...
Mark 1 Strange Assistance in your Campaign Log. Choose one effect you have not yet chosen this scenario, then set this card aside, out of play.
One of your companions calls out---they've found something! -Each investigator may search the top 9 cards of their deck for a card and draw it. Your eye catches on a small inscription you'd previously missed, and disparate ideas start clicking into place. -Discover 1[per_investigator] clues from your location. A hail of gunfire catches the foe in front of you in the chest, coming seemingly from nowhere. -Defeat a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location, or deal 1[per_investigator] damage to an [[Elite]] enemy at your location and exhaust it.

cards.name: Temporal Stutter
cards.text: Revelation - Add Temporal Stutter to your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test: After this test ends, place 1 of your clues on your location, then move once towards Front Gates. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Temporal Stutter.

cards.name: Unstuck
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the current agenda number.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, resolve the effects of the failed test an additional time.
[tablet]: –2. If you fail, draw the topmost treachery in the encounter discard pile.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail and you are at an [[Adrift]] location, after this test ends, swap the positions of your location and the location across from you.

cards.name: Unstuck
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the sum of the current act number and the current agenda number.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, resolve the effects of the failed test an additional time.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, draw the topmost treachery in the encounter discard pile.
[elder_thing]: –5. If you are at an [[Adrift]] location, after this test ends, swap the positions of your location and the location across from you.

cards.flavor: You fall through time, through existence, bouncing between bygone ages and far-flung futures. Your flight is barely controlled, try as you might to grasp on to passing days.
cards.name: Falling Apart
cards.text: Each [[Adrift]] location is connected to the locations clockwise and counter-clockwise from it.

cards.name: Falling Still
cards.text:
Your grip on reality loosens once again, sending you tumbling out of time.
Discard each non-weakness treachery card in play. Each investigator at an [[Adrift]] location moves to a random other [[Adrift]] location.

cards.flavor: Your flight is a little more controlled now. Tenuous, still, and chaotic, but you're gaining a loose understanding of this... place?
cards.name: Days Never Before Seen
cards.text: Each [[Adrift]] location is connected to the locations clockwise and counter-clockwise from it.

cards.name: Time Turned Dark
cards.text:
The air, such as it is, surrounding you shifts and turns. Fragments of the Myriad's ritual echo outward from their nexus, poisoning the well of time around you.
Discard each non-weakness treachery card in play. Each investigator at an [[Adrift]] location moves to a random other [[Adrift]] location. Shuffle the set-aside Paradox encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Place 1 doom on agenda 3a as it is revealed.

cards.flavor: The worlds around you are darker now, colder not in temperature but in the pressure they exert on your soul. The tampering of the Myriad can be felt throughout time and space.
cards.name: Bad Times
cards.text: Each [[Adrift]] location is connected to the locations clockwise and counter-clockwise from it.

cards.name: Reality Changes
cards.text:
Time sticks. For a moment—though what is a moment without time?—all is still, unnaturally so. Then, inevitably, you lurch out of reality and back into the maelstrom of intermingling times.
For each [[Adrift]] location occupied by an investigator, find the version of that location that was removed from the game and swap them (all tokens and cards at the former location are now considered to be at the new location). Do not place clues on the new locations as they are revealed. Discard each non-weakness treachery card in play. Each investigator at an [[Adrift]] location moves to a random other [[Adrift]] location. Place 1 doom on agenda 4a as it is revealed.

cards.flavor: Twist. Warp. Time changes. New days flicker and die, ancient secrets drift and flutter like leaves. Your heart beats not. This cannot last. You cannot hold.
cards.name: Breaking Point
cards.text: Each [[Adrift]] location is connected to the locations clockwise and counter-clockwise from it.

cards.name: No More
cards.text:
A thousand colours explode before your eyes, and infinity rips through your mind. Every moment you've ever lived, every agony and ecstasy you've ever felt, all flashes through you at once, overwhelming you with sheer sensation. Time's meaning ceases as fatigue takes you, and everything goes black.
Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: When you land, you have a brief moment to take in your surroundings, to learn what you can about this place, and each time you do you can hold on for a little longer. Perhaps, with enough focus, you can learn to navigate this place a little—enough to find a way out, at least.
cards.name: All of Time and Space
cards.text: [action]: Move. Test [willpower] (5). This test gets –1 difficulty for each doom on the current agenda. If you succeed, move to any [[Adrift]] location. If you fail, move to a random other [[Adrift]] location.

cards.name: A Path Appears
cards.text:
Swimming through time and space, you've gotten something of a feel for navigating distant times. As you float along, you hold an image in your head—home, blessed home—and begin to craft a path.
Put the set-aside The Timestream and Arkham, Massachusetts (Present Day?) locations into play.

cards.flavor: Time itself seems to be fighting you—forcing you from your intended path—but you struggle on. Arkham is within reach.
cards.name: Fighting the Tide
cards.text: [action]: Move. Test [willpower] (5). This test gets –1 difficulty for each doom on the current agenda. If you succeed, move to The Timestream or to any [[Adrift]] location. If you fail, move to a random other [[Adrift]] location. Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: Home
cards.text:
You land, splayed out in the streets of Easttown. The old, crooked buildings, the passers-by giving you suspicious looks—this is it. Arkham, Massachusetts, 1925.
→R1.

cards.flavor: The streets are busy and garishly lit. Strange devices flit to and fro, as mechanical eyes follow your every move.
cards.name: A Disquieting Future
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, draw a card. If you fail, take 1 horror and choose and discard a card from your hand.

cards.flavor:
You've found your way back to Arkham... you think. 
The city before you is unfamiliar to you, an oppressive vista of smoke and steel dotted with coloured lights.
cards.name: A Disquieting Future

cards.flavor: The streets are busy and garishly lit. Strange devices flit to and fro, as mechanical eyes follow your every move.
cards.name: A Disquieting Future
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [intellect](3). If you succeed, heal 1 damage or 1 horror. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
You've found your way back to Arkham... you think. 
The city before you is unfamiliar to you, an oppressive vista of smoke and steel dotted with coloured lights.
cards.name: A Disquieting Future
A World at War
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if there is no copy of Aerial Bombardment attached to A World at War: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Aerial Bombardment and draw it. Do not resolve its forced ability this turn.

cards.flavor:
A muddy battlefield is strung with barbed wire
and gun emplacements. A war is being 
waged here—one grand enough to rival 
the Great War whose scars still sit upon the world.
cards.name: A World at War
A World at War
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, place 1 of your clues on this location.

cards.flavor:
A muddy battlefield is strung with barbed wire
and gun emplacements. A war is being 
waged here—one grand enough to rival 
the Great War whose scars still sit upon the world.
cards.name: A World at War

cards.flavor:
The dry air is all too thin. You gulp it in desperately, 
but grow woozy at the lack of oxygen.
cards.name: An Earth Long Dead
cards.text: Forced - After you enter this location: Lose 1 action.

cards.flavor:
Before you lies one possible future—
a dry, barren Earth, utterly devoid of life.
cards.name: An Earth Long Dead

cards.flavor:
The dry air is all too thin. You gulp it in desperately, 
but grow woozy at the lack of oxygen.
cards.name: An Earth Long Dead
cards.text: Forced - After you enter this location: Take 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
Before you lies one possible future—
a dry, barren Earth, utterly devoid of life.
cards.name: An Earth Long Dead

cards.flavor:
The streets are cold and empty. 
Suspicious faces peer out of windows as you pass.
cards.name: Arkham, Massachusetts
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
It's the place you know, but not as you know it. 
In the midst of witch-hunting hysteria, 
the old city is gripped by paranoid suspicion.
cards.name: Arkham, Massachusetts

cards.flavor:
The streets are cold and empty. 
Suspicious faces peer out of windows as you pass.
cards.name: Arkham, Massachusetts
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, during the next upkeep phase, your exhausted cards cannot ready.

cards.flavor:
It's the place you know, but not as you know it. 
In the midst of witch-hunting hysteria, 
the old city is gripped by paranoid suspicion.
cards.name: Arkham, Massachusetts

cards.flavor:
The desert sun beats down on you, as the wind whips 
sand into your eyes. Looks like a storm is brewing...
cards.name: Banks of the Nile
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, lose 1 resource.

cards.flavor:
From the fact that the pyramids on the horizon 
seem to still be under construction, you surmise that 
you're still far from your own time.
cards.name: Banks of the Nile

cards.flavor:
The desert sun beats down on you, as the wind whips 
sand into your eyes. Looks like a storm is brewing...
cards.name: Banks of the Nile
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [intellect] (3). If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Sandstorm and draw it.

cards.flavor:
From the fact that the pyramids on the horizon 
seem to still be under construction, you surmise that 
you're still far from your own time.
cards.name: Banks of the Nile

cards.flavor: You stand in the beating heart of an organism spanning half the world. Beasts don't get much more dangerous.
cards.name: Heart of an Empire
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, move to a random other [[Adrift]] location. Do not resolve any forced abilities on that location that would trigger at the end of your turn.

cards.flavor: You stand in the beating heart of an organism spanning half the world. Beasts don't get much more dangerous.
cards.name: Heart of an Empire

cards.flavor: You stand in the beating heart of an organism spanning half the world. Beasts don't get much more dangerous.
cards.name: Heart of an Empire
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage.

cards.flavor: You stand in the beating heart of an organism spanning half the world. Beasts don't get much more dangerous.
cards.name: Heart of an Empire

cards.flavor: You're learning an awful lot about dinosaurs. Unfortunately, they're also learning rather a lot about you.
cards.name: Millions of Years Ago
cards.text: Enemies at Millions of Years Ago get +1 fight and –1 evade. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [combat] (3). If you fail, take X damage, where X is the number of clues you discovered this turn (min 1).

cards.flavor:
You find yourself surrounded by hot, dense jungle. 
Small lizards abound, and in the far distance you can hear the crashing of something much, much larger...
cards.name: Millions of Years Ago
Millions of Years Ago
cards.text: Enemies at Millions of Years Ago get +1 fight and –1 evade. Forced - At the end of your turn, if there are no [[Dinosaur]] enemies at this location: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Dinosaur]] enemy and spawn it at this location, exhausted. Shuffle the encounter deck.

cards.flavor:
You find yourself surrounded by hot, dense jungle. 
Small lizards abound, and in the far distance you can hear the crashing of something much, much larger...
cards.name: Millions of Years Ago
The Tatterdemalion
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully evade an enemy at this location: Defeat that enemy. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must either discard an asset you control, or take 1 horror for each point you failed by.

cards.flavor:
A strange metallic voice drifts from the walls: 
"Welcome aboard the Tatterdemalion. 
The current star date is March 28, 2147." 
A huge blue orb hangs outside the window, framed by the blackness of space—a planet, but not Earth.
cards.name: The Tatterdemalion
The Tatterdemalion
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully evade an enemy at this location: Defeat that enemy. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, discard a random card from your hand.

cards.flavor:
A strange metallic voice drifts from the walls: 
"Welcome aboard the Tatterdemalion. 
The current star date is March 28, 2147." 
A huge blue orb hangs outside the window, framed by the blackness of space—a planet, but not Earth.
cards.name: The Tatterdemalion
The Timestream
cards.text: [reaction] During a skill test at an [[Adrift]] location, spend 1 clue: You may commit a card to this skill test. Forced - At the end of your turn, if there is at least one clue on The Timestream: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, place one of your clues on your location.

cards.flavor: A bridge appears, formed by will and consciousness from the matter of this place. It won't be an easy journey, but following it will lead you home... you hope.
cards.name: The Timestream
Arkham, Massachusetts
cards.text: Forced - When Arkham, Massachusetts is revealed: Randomly choose 1 of the set-aside [[Elite]] enemies and spawn it at Arkham, Massachusetts (if there are 3 or 4 investigators in the game, also spawn 1 at The Timestream). [action] If there are no ready enemies at Arkham, Massachusetts: Resign. You rejoin your time.

cards.flavor:
You scarcely dare believe it, but the portal before 
you seems to lead you home. You never 
thought you'd be so happy to see the old city.
cards.name: Arkham, Massachusetts
cards.text: You cannot enter Arkham, Massachusetts. The Timestream gains "Forced - At the end of the round, if each undefeated investigator is at this location: Reveal Arkham, Massachusetts (Present Day?)."

cards.name: Time Runs Backwards
cards.text: Revelation - Shuffle your hand into your deck. If at least 3 cards are shuffled in this way, draw a card and add a non-exceptional card from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Determined General
cards.text: Alert. Retaliate. Determined General cannot be damaged while there is a ready Roman Soldier enemy at its location. Forced - After Determined General engages or attacks you: Put the top card of your deck into play in your threat area, as a Roman Soldier enemy with 3 fight, 1 health, 3 evade, 1 damage and the [[Humanoid]] trait.

cards.name: Panzer IV
cards.text: Massive. Forced - When enemies attack during the enemy phase, if Panzer IV is ready and unengaged: It attacks each investigator in each connecting location. If no attacks are made this way, move Panzer IV once towards the nearest investigator.

cards.name: Shambler from the Stars
cards.text: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - After you trigger an [action] ability at any location: Shambler from the Stars attacks you. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
cards.text: Massive. Forced - When you would attack or evade Tyrannosaurus Rex: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, cancel the triggering attack or evasion attempt. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Eager Sphinx
cards.text: Spawn - Banks of the Nile. Alert. Hunter. [action] If Eager Sphinx is ready and engaged with you: Parley. You attempt the riddle of the sphinx. Test [intellect] (4). If you fail, Eager Sphinx attacks you. If you succeed, choose one: defeat Eager Sphinx, draw 2 cards or gain 3 resources. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
"The hidden cults to which these witches 
belonged often guarded and handed down 
surprising secrets from elder, forgotten aeons."
—H. P. Lovecraft, <n>The Dreams in the Witch House
cards.name: Persecuted Witch
cards.text: Revelation - For each doom in play (min 1), discard the top card of the encounter deck. Draw a [[Hex]] or [[Paradox]] treachery discarded this way.

cards.name: Velociraptor
cards.text: Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Velociraptor engages an investigator during the mythos or investigator phases: It makes an immediate attack.

cards.name: Aerial Bombardment
cards.text: Revelation - Attach to your location. Limit 1 per location. Forced - When you leave attached location: Spend 1 action or take 1 damage. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at attached location: For each doom in play (min 1), take 1 damage or discard 1 card from your hand at random.

cards.name: Beckoning of Everywhen
cards.text: Revelation - If you are not at an [[Adrift]] location, Beckoning of Everywhen gains surge. Otherwise, reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you revealed a non-zero number, swap the positions of your location and the location X positions clockwise, where X is the modifier of the revealed token. If you revealed a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], [curse] or [auto_fail], move to the location across from you.

cards.name: Cabin Pressure
cards.text: Revelation - Put Cabin Pressure into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn, if there are 1 or more clues on your location: Take 2 damage and discard Cabin Pressure. [action][action] If Cabin Pressure is in your threat area: Discard Cabin Pressure.

cards.name: Dark Maledict
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - For each doom in play (min 1), choose a different option: -Choose an investigator to take 2 horror. -Choose a damaged enemy and heal 2 damage from it. -Each investigator chooses and discards a card from their hand.

cards.flavor: This is not what you hoped the future would be.
cards.name: Dystopia
cards.text: Revelation - Put Dystopia into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (X), where X is the amount of doom in play. If you fail, take 1 horror, which must be assigned to an [[Ally]] asset if able.

cards.name: Morbid Curiosity
cards.text: Revelation - Add Morbid Curiosity to your threat area. Forced - When you would move to a location other than An Earth Long Dead during your turn: Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, move to An Earth Long Dead instead, take 1 horror and discard Morbid Curiosity.

cards.name: Overwhelming Numbers
cards.text: Revelation - Each investigator at your location tests [combat] or [agility] (4). An investigator at your location may place one of their clues on your location to reduce the difficulty of each test by 2. Each investigator that fails takes 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.name: Roman Outpost
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Roman Outpost to the nearest non-[[Rome]] location. Roman Outpost cannot leave play. Forced - When you begin your turn at attached location, or enter it during your turn: Put the top card of your deck into play in your threat area, as a Roman Soldier enemy with 3 fight, 1 health, 3 evade, 1 damage and the [[Humanoid]] trait.

cards.name: Sandstorm
cards.text: Revelation - Attach to the revealed [[Adrift]] location with the most clues and without a copy of Sandstorm attached. Attached location gets +1 shroud for each doom in play (min 1).

cards.name: The Endless Fall
cards.text: Revelation - If you are not at an [[Adrift]] location, The Endless Fall gains surge. Otherwise, trigger the forced ability on your location as if it were the end of your turn. If you fail a skill test by 2 or more while resolving this ability, move to the location in the clockwise direction, then repeat this process.

cards.name: A Year to Plan
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is half the number of completed [[Tasks]] (rounded down).
[cultist]: –5. Draw a card or gain a resource.
[tablet]: –2. If you fail and it is your turn, lose all remaining actions and end your turn.
[elder_thing]: –3. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.name: A Year to Plan
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of completed [[Tasks]].
[cultist]: –8. Draw a card or gain a resource.
[tablet]: –4. If you fail and it is your turn, lose all remaining actions and end your turn.
[elder_thing]: –5. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.flavor: One year. One year before the Myriad carry out their ritual to unify all time. You can't stop them pre-emptively—if the ritual does not happen, you can't fall through into the past, so can't stop the ritual from happening... Just thinking about it gives you a headache.
cards.name: Autumn
cards.text: Each copy of The Myriad Gentleman loses hunter, and gains aloof and "Spawn - Any empty location."

cards.name: Opening Moves
cards.text:
All across the world, the Myriad are moving, readying everything for the arrival of their master. In Egypt, an ancient creature is roused. In France, a strange portal is torn open. And everywhere, the gentleman watches. He knows you're here, now.
Put the set-aside Keeper of Knowledge and Strange Portal treacheries into play next to the act deck, resolving their revelation effects. (Note: Each copy of The Myriad Gentleman is no longer aloof.)

cards.flavor: The days grow colder, and the nights draw in. Sometimes. Other times, you find yourself in the southern hemisphere, and the days are long and hot. The war you're waging takes you to all kinds of places. You just wish you had a little more time to take in the sights, and also that you weren't locked in battle with a strange cult trying to unmake time itself.
cards.name: Winter
cards.text: If there is only 1 investigator in the game, this agenda gets +1 doom threshold.

cards.name: A Curious Expedition
cards.text:
It seems at first like a standard archaeological trip, travelling from Frankfurt to the site of the Tunguska event. It's only through careful digging that you discover that the expedition was funded entirely by the Myriad.
Put the set-aside The Tunguska Event treachery into play next to the act deck. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: Six months have passed. Six months of constant travel, of back and forth between you and the Myriad. Six more months to go.
cards.name: Spring
cards.text: If there is only 1 investigator in the game, this agenda gets +1 doom threshold.

cards.name: Time Runs Short
cards.text:
The night of the ritual is fast approaching. If there's anything you need to have prepared, you'd better get to it.
Put the set-aside Final Preparations treachery into play next to the act deck.

cards.flavor: As the days grow longer and hotter, you find yourself filled with tension. Soon, now, the Sheldon gang will be hired to burn your home down and wipe you out. (A mistake on the part of the Myriad, you now understand—they haven't yet realised that there are two versions of you operating in this time. They created their own worst enemy.) Everything begins again, then everything ends. Better get back to Arkham.
cards.name: Summer
The Day of Reckoning
cards.text:
The time has come to stop the Myriad once and for all. You've got to get back to Arkham first, of course...
→R1.

cards.name: The Long Game
cards.text: [free] The investigators spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Put the top card of the Task deck into play next to the act deck, resolving its revelation effect. (Group limit once per round.) Objective - Complete as many [[Task]] treacheries as possible. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

cards.name: The Beginning of the End
cards.text:
It's time.
→R1.

cards.name: Arkham, Massachusetts
cards.text: [action] Investigators at this location spend 2[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remove 1 resource from Helping Yourself. [action][action]: Move to London or Paris. [action]: Resign. You return to Arkham, ready for what is to come.

cards.flavor:
In many ways, the city hasn't changed from when 
last you were here. 1924 wasn't so different to the present day, after all. Still, with everything that's happened—everything you've seen and done—you don't think you'll ever look at the place in the same way again.
cards.name: Arkham, Massachusetts
San Francisco
cards.text: During the upkeep phase, investigators in San Francisco gain 1 additional resource. [action][action]: Move to Shanghai or Sydney.

cards.flavor:
San Francisco's streetcar system, despite being 
unfinished, is remarkably efficient, and 
makes conducting business in the city easier.
cards.name: San Francisco
Mexico City
cards.text:
While you are in Mexico City, reduce the cost of each [[Item]] asset you play by 1.
[action] Discard an [[Item]] asset you control: Gain 2 clues from the token pool. (Limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
Having avoided the worst of the violence of the 
Mexican Revolution, Mexico City is in the midst of a population boom, sprawling ever further westward.
cards.name: Mexico City
London
cards.text: As an additional cost to investigate London, choose and discard a card from hand. [action][action]: Move to Arkham, Massachusetts.

cards.flavor:
Standing on the banks of the river Thames 
as it wends its way through the city, 
you feel the strangest urge to throw tea into it.
cards.name: London

cards.flavor:
The city of lights is beautiful, but don't be fooled: 
the Myriad have a great deal of sway with the local authorities here. Best to keep a low profile.
cards.name: Paris
cards.text: [action][action]: Move to Arkham, Massachusetts. Forced - After you defeat an enemy in Paris: Lose an action.

cards.flavor:
The city of lights is beautiful, but don't be fooled: 
the Myriad have a great deal of sway with the local authorities here. Best to keep a low profile.
cards.name: Paris
Rome
cards.text: Forced - After you investigate Rome, if you did not succeed by at least 2: Lose an action.

cards.flavor:
Modern Rome, increasingly nationalistic and entirely 
in the grasp of Mussolini's National Fascist Party, 
is not the nicest place to be. Still, the Gentleman doesn't seem to mind too much, so neither can you.
cards.name: Rome
Istanbul
cards.text:
[action] Spend 2 resources: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror.
[reaction] After you move to Istanbul, but before enemies at your new location engage you, spend 2 resources: Move to a connecting location.

cards.flavor:
The city of Constantinople, known informally as Istanbul, was occupied by foreign forces until very recently. 
The newfound Republic of Turkey is still finding its feet.
cards.name: Istanbul
Cairo
cards.text:
Cairo gets +1 shroud for each action you have completed this turn.
[reaction] After you successfully investigate Cairo: Search the top 3 cards of your deck for a card and draw it.

cards.flavor:
"The following principles are hereby declared:
1. The British Protectorate over Egypt is terminated, and 
Egypt is declared to be an independent sovereign State.
2. So soon as the Government of His Highness shall pass an Act of Indemnity with application to all inhabitants of Egypt, martial law as proclaimed on 2 November 1914, shall be withdrawn."
<n>---Unilateral Declaration of Egyptian Independence, 1922
cards.name: Cairo

cards.flavor:
"I felt an odd reluctance about approaching, 
and did so at last only because my business took me through and past it. There was no vegetation of any kind on that broad expanse, but only a fine grey dust or ash which no wind seemed ever to blow about."
—H.P. Lovecraft, <n>The Colour Out of Space
cards.name: Tunguska

cards.flavor:
"I felt an odd reluctance about approaching, 
and did so at last only because my business took me through and past it. There was no vegetation of any kind on that broad expanse, but only a fine grey dust or ash which no wind seemed ever to blow about."
—H.P. Lovecraft, <n>The Colour Out of Space
cards.name: Tunguska
Himalayas
cards.text: You must spend an additional action to investigate the Himalayas. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Himalayas: Take 1 damage.

cards.flavor:
Eleven people have died on this mountain range since 
the start of the decade. Maybe watch your step.
cards.name: Himalayas
Shanghai
cards.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Shanghai: Lose 2 resources. [action][action]: Move to San Francisco or Sydney. [action] Spend 3 resources: Gain 1 clue from the token pool. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
The Shanghai Bund holds trading houses from dozens 
of countries the world over. The information you need can probably be found here... but it won't come cheap.
cards.name: Shanghai

cards.flavor:
There's something ancient in Australia, an aspect 
of it lurking near Sydney. It's not exactly friendly, 
but maybe it will at least be helpful...
cards.name: Sydney
cards.text: [action][action]: Move to San Francisco or Shanghai. [action] If there are no clues on Sydney: Place 4 clues on Sydney. Draw 2 cards and gain 2 resources. Move to any other location.

cards.flavor:
A presence hangs over Sydney. To most it's barely there, 
a passing feeling not worth a second thought, but 
you've seen enough to know better. Something watches Sydney. Perhaps something that could help you?
cards.name: Sydney
Curse of a Thousand Winters
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, put Curse of a Thousand Winters into play in your threat area with X resources on, where X is the amount you failed by. Forced - At the start of your turn: Lose 1 action. Remove 1 resource from Curse of a Thousand Winters. Then, if there are no resources on Curse of a Thousand Winters, discard it.

cards.flavor: "Quis irrumabo es?"
cards.name: Displaced Legion
cards.text: Massive. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4) to communicate with the soldiers. If you succeed, until the end of the round, Displaced Legion loses massive and gains aloof. [action] If Displaced Legion is aloof: Test [willpower] (4) to open a portal through time. If you succeed, add Displaced Legion to the victory display.

cards.flavor:
600 pounds of muscle. Foot-long fangs. 
Extinct for ten thousand years.
cards.name: Smilodon
cards.text: Spawn - Any connecting location (empty, if able). Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Smilodon moves via its hunter keyword: It gets +1 damage and +1 horror until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: Without the people we love, who are we?
cards.name: A Long and Lonely Year
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X), where X is 1 more than the current agenda number. If you fail, either take 1 horror for each point you failed by, or move to Arkham, Massachusetts.

cards.name: A Multitude of Plots
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): -Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This can cause the current agenda to advance. This card gains surge. Remove this card from the game. -Add this card to the victory display. (This will advance the plans of the Myriad, making subsequent scenarios harder.)

cards.flavor: Anything you do in your own name will interfere with your past. It is imperative that you tread lightly.
cards.name: Without Home or Identity
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, lose 1 resource for each point you fail by, and take 1 damage.

cards.name: Helping Yourself
cards.text: You understand now. All the strange things that happened—the unexplained assistance you received—that was all you. This you, helping set things up for past you. ...You should probably get started on that. Task – Remove all resources from Helping Yourself.

cards.name: Enemy of My Enemy
cards.text: High in the Himalayas, an order of monks resists the machinations of the Myriad. Perhaps if you visit them, they could provide some assistance. There's only one small problem... Revelation - Spawn the set-aside Savage Yeti enemy at the Himalayas. Task – Deal with the Savage Yeti.

cards.name: A Treasure Unearthed
cards.text: Rumors abound of an ancient arcane tome, recently acquired by the British Library. That kind of power could come in handy, but it will surely be closely guarded. Revelation - Put the set-aside The British Library into play, revealed location side faceup. Task – Steal a tome from the British Library.

cards.name: The Devil You Know
cards.text: The Silver Twilight Lodge is something of a fixture in Arkham. Secretive, yes, and undoubtedly dangerous... But powerful. Power you can use, perhaps. Revelation - Attach the set-aside Contacting the Lodge treachery to Arkham, Massachusetts. Task – Win the favor of the Silver Twilight Lodge.

cards.name: Higher Powers
cards.text: An organisation like the FBI is unlikely to believe stories of time travel, monsters and forgotten gods. The Myriad has its fingers in a lot of pies, though; if enough of these connections were shown to the Bureau, perhaps they could be convinced. Revelation - Attach Exposition to San Francisco. Place 1 resource on each of Mexico City, Istanbul and Shanghai. Task – Expose the operations of the Myriad.

cards.name: Entreating the Gods
cards.text: Aforgomon is not the only entity with interests in the timestream. An ancient spirit sits in opposition to it, and you've heard enough tales of fevered dreams from Sydney to have a good idea of where you might find it. Revelation - Attach the set-aside Distant Entity asset to Sydney. Task – Make contact with a distant entity.

cards.name: Up To Something
cards.text: The Myriad Gentleman, you have been reliably informed, has been spotted in Italy no fewer than half a dozen times. You don't doubt that he's in most places, if you look hard enough, but this seems an unusual amount of attention. Revelation - Attach the set-aside Scheme of the Myriad to Rome. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 2 copies of The Myriad Gentleman and spawn them in Rome. Task – Find whatever the Myriad is after in Rome.

cards.name: Chronal Atlas
cards.text: Uses (3 secrets). You get +1 [intellect]. [reaction] When you would reveal a chaos token, exhaust Chronal Atlas and spend 1 secret: Reveal 2 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose 1 of those tokens to resolve, and seal the other here. Forced - At the end of the round: Return any tokens sealed on Chronal Atlas to the chaos bag.

cards.name: Forestall Fate
cards.text:
Fast.
Uses (4 charges).
[free] Exhaust Forestall Fate and spend 1 charge:
Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, gain an action. If a [elder_thing] or [auto_fail] token is revealed during this skill test, take 2 horror or lose an action.

cards.name: Ionian Pendant
cards.text: [reaction] When you would perform a skill test during a revelation effect, exhaust Ionian Pendant and place 1 horror on it: You may use [combat] in place of the listed skill for that test.

cards.name: Wings of Damakairon
cards.text:
Fast.
You get +1 [agility].
[free] Exhaust Wings of Damakairon: Your location gets –2 shroud for this skill test. You may not use this ability during your turn.

cards.name: Agency Strike Team
cards.text: Choose either your location or a connecting location. Either deal 3 damage to each enemy at the chosen location, or discover 3 clues at the chosen location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: Monastic Training
cards.text: While Monastic Training is in your discard pile, when you reveal a [skull] token during a skill test, after this test resolves you may discard a card to add Monastic Training to your hand.

cards.name: Another Realm
cards.text: Forced - When an investigator at Another Realm draws an enemy: Discard it. That investigator draws the top card of the encounter deck. [action] If there are no clues on Another Realm: Flip this card over and resolve its text.

cards.name: Destination
cards.text:
You walk for what seems like years through the endless, glittering expanse. Eventually, you reach a house built out of the same vibrant colour as the rest of the landscape. This must be your destination. Inside, you find a small red-haired woman in a green dress. She offers you a seat and makes you tea. You ask about the portal and its peculiar destination, and she speaks of the realm's transportative powers. You plead with her to seal the portal, lest the Myriad Gentleman find it and seize this land for his own. The threat to her home rather sobers her, and she agrees to close the realm off for a time. She walks you to the portal. With her at your side, it takes but a few minutes.
In your Campaign Log, record that "you took tea with the ruler of a strange dimension." Complete Strange Portal. Each investigator at this location moves to Paris. Flip this card over and add it to the victory display.

cards.name: The British Library
cards.text:
The British Library gets –1 shroud for each clue on it.
[action] If investigators at The British Library possess at least 3 clues, as a group: Flip this card over and resolve its text.

cards.name: Book Heist
cards.text:
In a hidden chamber buried deep in the library, you find the tome, guarded, under lock and key.
You must decide (choose one): -Wait for your moment, then swoop in and grab it. Investigators at your location spend 3 clues, as a group. Test [agility] (0). This test gets +1 difficulty for each clue on the British Library. If you succeed, put the set-aside Chronal Atlas asset into play under your control and complete A Treasure Unearthed. For the remainder of this scenario, Chronal Atlas does not take up a hand slot. Then, flip this card back over; if you succeeded, for the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again. -It's just not worth the risk. Flip this card back over.

cards.name: Distant Entity
cards.text:
Attached location gains:
"[action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, place a resource on Distant Entity.
[action][action] If there are 3 resources on Distant Entity: Flip it over and resolve its text."

cards.name: A Blessing from On High
cards.text:
You spend days entreating the being, to no avail. On the third night, though, you dream of crimson and white, and of an unknowable creature, unimaginably vast in dimensions you cannot comprehend, its gaze fixed on you. You awaken soaked in sweat, with a single word fixed in your head: "Go." You leave Sydney early the next day. It's not until you've reached dry land on the far side of the ocean that you begin to feel a strange influence tingling up your spine...
Move to Shanghai. Put the set-aside Wings of Damakairon asset into play under your control. For the remainder of this scenario, it does not take up a body slot. Complete Entreating the Gods. Remove this card from the game.

cards.name: Ancient Sphinx
cards.text: Alert. [action]: Parley. You attempt the riddle of the sphinx. Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, place 1 of your clues on Ancient Sphinx, then if there are at least 1[per_investigator] clues on Ancient Sphinx, flip this card over and resolve its text. If you fail, Ancient Sphinx attacks you. Forced - When Ancient Sphinx leaves play: Complete Keeper of Knowledge.

cards.name: Answers
cards.text:
The sphinx smiles at your response, revealing row upon row of wickedly sharp teeth. "My, my, what a clever little morsel you are," it purrs. "Tell me, small one, what do you seek from me?"
You must decide (choose one): -"Knowledge." Draw cards until you reach your maximum hand size. -"Power." Distribute 5 supplies, ammo, charges or secrets, in any combination, among assets you control. -"Wealth." Gain 10 resources. -"Aid." Move to any location. Deal 3 damage to an enemy at that location. In your Campaign Log, record you solved the riddle of the sphinx. Complete Keeper of Knowledge. Flip this card back over and add it to the victory display.

cards.name: Brainwashed Expedition
cards.text: Massive. Swarming 2. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are 4 or fewer swarm cards under this card: Add 1 swarm card to Brainwashed Expedition. Forced - When the host Brainwashed Expedition is defeated: Flip it over and resolve its text.

cards.name: Window of Opportunity
cards.text:
You cut your way through the members of the expedition, each compelled to slice at you with whatever they have to hand—pocket knives, archaeological gear, shards of rock. You pant with the exertion, finding yourself momentarily clear, but still the strange aurora circles, poking and prodding at your mind. You must find a way to stop it.
You must decide (choose one): -You retreat, while you still have that option. Each investigator at your location may move to a connecting location. Flip this card back over and restore it to 1[per_investigator] health. -You move toward the dig site, determined to seal this thing back where it came from. An investigator at your location tests [willpower] (3). If they succeed, complete The Tunguska Event, flip this card back over and add it to the victory display. Otherwise, flip this this card back over and restore it to 1[per_investigator] health.

cards.flavor: ...Well, maybe not so small.
cards.name: Savage Yeti
cards.text: Retaliate. If Savage Yeti is damaged, it gets +2 fight and +2 evade. Forced - If Savage Yeti is defeated: Flip this card over and resolve its text.

cards.name: Gratitude
cards.text:
As you slay the beast harrying the monastery, the monks begin to emerge. "We are much obliged to you, stranger," one says. You explain your mission, your opposition to the Myriad, and the man smiles. "Well, then, come inside. There is much you have to learn."
Add the set-aside Monastic Training skill to your hand. For the remainder of this scenario, you are considered to own this card. Complete Enemy of My Enemy. Remove this card from the game.

cards.flavor:
Communicating with the Order of the Silver Twilight is difficult, but not impossible. They offer you their aid, 
in exchange for a small favor.
cards.name: Contacting the Lodge
cards.text: [action]: Test [agility] (9). You may spend any number of additional actions when you perform this action. You get +2 [agility] for this skill test for each action being spent (including this ability's [action] cost). If you succeed, flip this card over and resolve its text.

cards.name: Favors for Favors
cards.text:
The job is simple enough: break into an eccentric millionaire's private collection, liberate a couple of pieces, drop them off at a local bakery. The package comes through two weeks later, a silver pendant and a message: "We will be there."
In your Campaign Log, record that "you have advanced the schemes of the Silver Twilight Lodge." Put the set-aside Ionian Pendant into play under your control. For the remainder of this scenario, it does not take up an accessory slot. Complete The Devil You Know. Remove this card from the game.

cards.name: Exposition
cards.text:
[reaction] When you successfully investigate Mexico City, Istanbul or Shanghai: Instead of discovering clues, move 1 resource from that location to this card. Investigators at any location may trigger this ability.
[action] If there are 3 resources on this card: Flip this card over and resolve its text.

cards.name: Grudging Assistance
cards.text:
The Myriad has ties to the Bureau too, as it turns out. You find yourself playing cat and mouse for a while, digging up evidence of the Myriad's plans while avoiding their attempts to ensnare you in red tape.
