In the end, you receive a lukewarm missive stating that the FBI are looking into the matter, and that you should stay out of it. Disappointing. Still, you've made a few contacts, and should be able to call in a few favours when needed.
Add the set-aside Agency Strike Team event to your hand. For the remainder of this scenario, you are considered to own this card. Complete Higher Powers. Remove this card from the game.

cards.name: Final Preparations
cards.text: This is going to be a rough conflict—any advantage you can make for yourself could be crucial. [free] The investigators spend 2[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 resource on the current act. Task – Place as many resources on the current act as you can. If there are 3 resources on the current act, complete Final Preparations.

cards.name: Keeper of Knowledge
cards.text: A sphinx has been sighted in Egypt, enough times for you to take the rumours seriously. You don't doubt that the Myriad have something to do with its appearance; you should endeavour to get to it before they do. Revelation - Spawn the set-aside Ancient Sphinx enemy in Cairo. Task – Acquire the knowledge of the sphinx.

cards.name: Scheme of the Myriad
cards.text: [[Myriad]] enemies at attached location lose aloof and hunter. [action] If there are no ready [[Myriad]] enemies at this location: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, flip this card over and resolve its text.

cards.name: Harnessing a Tear in Reality
cards.text:
You find the cause of the Myriad's interest: the ruins of the Colosseum. Pushing past barriers and signs marked "DANGER", you find yourself standing in the arena's center, gazing on a split in the fabric of time. It's clear from the paraphernalia surrounding it that the Myriad have been trying to harness this breach—perhaps you can finish their work yourself.
Put the set-aside Forestall Fate asset into play under your control. For the remainder of this scenario, it does not take up an arcane slot. Complete Up To Something. Remove this card from the game.

cards.name: Strange Portal
cards.text: The rift has attracted surprisingly little attention, and the French police, fearing the danger it may pose, have been keeping people away from it. The Myriad, predictably, are sniffing around—try to get to it first. Revelation - Put the set-aside Another Realm into play. Task – Explore the strange portal.

cards.name: The Tunguska Event
cards.text: No one really knows what happened at Tunguska. Well, perhaps not no one. The Myriad certainly seem to know something. [reaction] At the end of the round, investigators at Tunguska spend 2[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Flip this card over and resolve its text. Task – Uncover the Myriad's plans for Tunguska.

cards.name: Colour Out of Space
cards.text:
You find the expedition before too long. They've set up a dig site near the centre of the strange crater. You settle in to a good vantage point, hoping to spy what's going on. Before too long, there's a shout from the dig site. People—some of them, but not all, being versions of The Myriad Gentleman—start to gather around, a commotion builds, and then all go stock still. A strange colour, something you can only even call colour by analogy, drifts from the hole, flowing around the archaeological group. As one, they turn, and start moving towards you.
Put the set-aside Brainwashed Expedition enemy into play at Tunguska. Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

cards.name: A World Torn Down, Again
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of actions you have remaining.
[cultist]: –1. If you succeed, you get +1 skill value during skill tests until the end of the round.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, place 1 doom on the current agenda.
[elder_thing]: –5. Take 1 horror.

cards.name: A World Torn Down, Again
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 1 more than the number of actions you have remaining.
[cultist]: –3. If you succeed, you get +1 skill value during skill tests until the end of the round.
[tablet]: –5. If you fail, place 1 doom on the current agenda.
[elder_thing]: You automatically fail. Take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: You're back in Arkham, a year wiser and a year more worn down. You know how this goes—the ritual has begun, and you need to put a stop to it.
cards.name: Once More Unto the Breach
Time Breaking Slowly
cards.text:
As the ritual progresses, time stretches out ever longer. Your movements slow, and out of the corner of your eye, the school around you seems to be changing, unravelling.
Each investigator tests [willpower] (4). Each investigator who succeeds gains an action. Each investigator who fails loses an action. Check your Campaign Log. If [an enemy] disappeared unexpectedly, spawn the set-aside copy of that enemy at the lead investigator's location.

cards.flavor: As the very fabric of your existence wears thin, the Gentleman and the creatures that serve him stand against you in ever greater numbers. His seeming hatred of you makes more sense now you've spent an entire year thwarting his plans.
cards.name: Time Running Short
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you have any standard actions remaining: You gain 1 action for the next round.

cards.name: A Familiar Chaos
cards.text:
Time is running out, or running together, or simply falling apart. Nothing around you is stable. Ancient things become new and effect precedes cause. You grit your teeth and keep fighting, knowing you can't hold on much longer.
Each investigator reveals a random token from the chaos bag. -Each investigator who reveals a symbol loses 1 action and gets +1 skill value during skill tests until the end of the round. -Each other investigator gains 1 action and gets –1 skill value during skill tests until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: As the ritual reaches a crescendo, you feel the days of your life stacked up against one another. You can see your past of blissful innocence, every day spent fighting this terible cult, and through it all the gaze of Aforgomon's three eyes. You rail against it, fighting on even as time around you melts away.
cards.name: Rage Against The End
cards.text: Forced - When the doom threshold is checked, if there is 4 or more doom in play: Each investigator loses 1 action. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you have any standard actions remaining: You gain actions for the next round equal to the number you have remaining (to a maximum of 3).

cards.name: All Times Are One
cards.text:
You can't hold on any longer. You let go, as time falls apart.
Each remaining investigator is defeated.

cards.flavor: Your job is complicated by the fact that the school you broke into a year ago—well, today—is... gone. There's not even a space where it should be. Something here is very wrong.
cards.name: A Dimension of its Own
A Riddle of Sorts
cards.text:
The space around where the school should be iswrong. Space bends in an unnatural manner, your steps not bringing you to where they should. So, it should just be a matter of moving to where you cannot... And sure enough, after doing the impossible, Mount Hollyoke ripples into view, the strange dimension around it slipping away.
Put Front Gates, Sports Field, Children's Playground and Side Building into play. Move each investigator and enemy in play to Sports Field. Remove Featureless Streets from the game. If the investigators used the school's front door, put Rear Corridors into play. Otherwise, put Front Hallway into play.

cards.flavor: A greenish, shimmering barrier surrounds the school, letting nothing through. You'll need to use a different entrance to your past self, and not disturb the barrier too much lest they—you—notice.
cards.name: The Boundary
cards.text: If act 1c is in play, investigators must spend an additional 1[per_investigator] clues to enter an unrevealed [[Interior]] location. Objective - If an investigator enters an [[Interior]] location, advance.

cards.name: Breaking the Boundary
cards.text:
Preparing the components you've gathered and uttering a familiar incantation, you step into the barrier, parting it wide enough to allow you passage.
If the Myriad recruited a cruel sorcerer, spawn the set-aside Estravius Malone at the revealed [[Interior]] location.
If you advanced by entering the Front Hallway:
As you step through the school's front doors, you are stopped in your tracks by the sight of a colossal, slumbering beast blocking your path.
Put the set aside Cafeteria and Principal's Office locations into play. Spawn the set-aside Hound of Unmaking at the Front Hallway. Shuffle each set-aside copy of Stirring Titan into the encounter deck. Advance to Act 3a – Big and Ugly.
If you advanced by entering the Rear Corridors:
You slip into the school through the back and spot a door at the end of the hall wrapped in purplish energy.
Put the set aside Classroom locations into play. Attach the set aside Unstable Warding story asset to Rear Corridors. If there is at least one [elder_thing] token in the chaos bag, place 1 horror on Unstable Warding. Advance to Act 3a – Doorway to the Unknown.

cards.flavor: The beast must be woken if you are to gain access deeper into the school. You don't relish the prospect of fighting it, but luring it away is going to be tricky, given the presence of your other selves...
cards.name: Big and Ugly
cards.text: Whilst the Hound of Unmaking is undamaged, it cannot make attacks. Objective - Investigators at Cafeteria may spend the requisite number of clues to advance. Objective - If the Hound of Unmaking is defeated, advance.

cards.name: Physical Education
cards.text:
If you spent clues to advance:
You assemble some of the more questionable spell components you've found into a sort of arcane bait. The beast pads its way out of the building to the hall where you've prepared the bait, consumes it in one large bite, then settles down for a nap.
Remove the Hound of Unmaking from the game.
If you defeated the Hound of Unmaking:
The beast lets out a haunting wail, and the whole corridor shakes as its form collapses to the ground. You let out a breath you didn't realise you were holding, and get to work moving the immense body out of your way.
However you advanced: Put each set-aside Ritual Circle location into play. Check your Campaign Log. If the investigators eliminated the high priest is not recorded, spawn the set-aside The Myriad Gentleman (The High Priest) at any Ritual Circle location (A Harnessed Future, if possible). Advance to Act 4a – Breaking the Circles.

cards.flavor: The door at the end of the hall crackles with energy that pulses and flows erratically. Much as you'd rather not touch it, that door must lead to where you need to be.
cards.name: Doorway to the Unknown
cards.text: Objective - If there are 4 resources on Unstable Warding, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Myriad Encounters
cards.text:
If there are 4 resources on Unstable Warding:
The ward is powerful, the energy crackling through it enough to power a small city. Nevertheless, you manage to disrupt its flow, grounding the magic and allowing you passage.
Remove Unstable Warding from the game.
If the investigators unleashed chaos:
The energy of the broken ward ripples out, disturbing and destabilising the Myriad's ritual.
Place 4[per_investigator] clues on Ritual Circle (A Harnessed Future) as it enters play. Then, remove 1[per_investigator] clues from Ritual Circle (A Harnessed Future) for each resource on Unstable Warding.
However you advanced:
You step through the now unprotected doorway and find yourself face to face, once again, with the Myriad Gentleman. Wearing decadent ceremonial robes, he assumes a defensive stance, drawing sigils in the air before him.
Put each set-aside Ritual Circle location into play. Spawn the set aside The Myriad Gentleman (The High Priest) at the Ritual Circle (A Harnessed Future). Advance to Act 4a – Breaking the Circles.

cards.flavor: At the center of the school sit the three huge ritual circles, as you remember them. You started disrupting them a whole year ago—now it's time to finish the job.
cards.name: Breaking the Circles
cards.text: Objective - If each Ritual Circle location is revealed and has no clues on it, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Glimpse of Things to Come
cards.text:
Energy twists and roils through the auditorium, the unbound rifts expanding uncontrollably. Cultists scatter, abandoning their implements in a desperate attempt to preserve their own lives. You hold fast. You've witnessed your past self plunge headlong into the timestream, but you've learnt a lot since then. Enough to be able to navigate the flow of existence, and enough to know that Aforgomon won't rest now that the ritual has failed. This breach is the in-road it needs to unmake time itself. You step once more into the timestream, ready to do battle with a god.
(→R1).

cards.flavor: Elsewhere on the grounds of this school, your past self is trying to break down the boundary too. They must not know you're here.
cards.name: What Came Before
cards.text: Each [[Interior]] location gets +2 shroud. Objective - When the boundary is broken, advance.

cards.name: Predestined Progress
cards.text:
The emerald barrier ripples as elsewhere, a neutralising ritual is performed. That should make things easier.
Check your Campaign Log. If the investigators used the school's front door, advance to Act 2c – Hellish Hound. Otherwise, advance to Act 2c – Warded Way.

cards.flavor: Right now, your past self is attempting to deal with a gargantuan beast around the front of the school. You can't say you envy them, really.
cards.name: Hellish Hound
cards.text: Objective - When the investigators repelled the Hound of Unmaking, advance. Objective - When the investigators put down the Hound of Unmaking, advance. Objective - When the investigators fell to the Myriad, advance to Act 3d.

cards.name: Oh.
cards.text:
If the investigators repelled the Hound of Unmaking:
The scream of an alarm breaks the site's eerie silence, followed by the howl of a beast. You remember how you used the school bell to frighten off the ritual's guardian, sending it fleeing towards... Oh. Oh dear.
Spawn the set-aside Hound of Unmaking at the Rear Corridors. (If Rear Corridors are not in play, spawn it at the lead investigator's location instead.) If an amount of damage is recorded for it in your Campaign Log, it enters play with that much damage on it. Advance to Act 3c – The First Circle.
If the investigators put down the Hound of Unmaking:
You hear a faint wail in the distance, as a terrible beast is slain.
Advance to Act 3c – The First Circle.

cards.flavor: Right now, your past self faces a doorway sealed with an arcane ward. Not much you can do to help them, so best to focus on your own path.
cards.name: Warded Way
cards.text: Objective - When the investigators unleashed chaos, advance. Objective - When the investigators dispelled the ward, advance. Objective - When the investigators fell to the Myriad, advance to Act 3d.

cards.name: Chaos
cards.text:
If the investigators unleashed chaos:
The air sizzles, and the walls spark and glow as your past self breaks the arcane barrier in a way that some might consider foolhardy.
Shuffle each set-aside copy of Unleashed Chaos into the encounter deck. Advance to Act 3c – The First Circle.
If the investigators dispelled the ward:
You judge that your past self will have dispelled the wards by now.
Advance to Act 3c – The First Circle.

cards.flavor: Your past self has reached the ritual chamber, and will be attempting to disrupt the ritual as best they can. You'll need to be especially careful that they don't spot you.
cards.name: The First Circle
cards.text: Forced - After you end your turn at a [[Ritual]] location: Test [willpower] or [agility] (3). Take 1 horror for each point you fail by. Objective - When the investigators fell to the Myriad, advance. Objective - When the investigators broke the first circle, advance.

cards.name: All Caught Up
cards.text:
With your past self gone, your job becomes rather simpler: finish disrupting the Myriad's ritual, before it's too late.
Remove the remainder of this act deck from the game.

cards.flavor: There definitely used to be something here...
cards.name: Featureless Streets

cards.flavor: There definitely used to be something here...
cards.name: Featureless Streets
Front Gates
cards.text: Forced - After you reveal Front Gates, if act 1c is in play: Reveal cards from the encounter deck until a copy of Preserve Causality or You Must Not Be Seen is revealed. Draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

cards.flavor: The front gates mark the point where you entered the school a year ago. They are a place to be very, very careful.
cards.name: Front Gates

cards.flavor:
Running this maze a second time should be easier, 
but the corridors seem to have moved since 
the last time you were here. Which is right now.
cards.name: Side Building
cards.text: This location's shroud cannot be reduced. Forced - After you successfully investigate Side Building: Side Building gets +2 shroud until the end of the round.

cards.flavor: The barrier around the school only protects its main building. A ramshackle secondary structure stands within your reach, looking ready to collapse at any moment.
cards.name: Side Building
Children's Playground
cards.text: [reaction] When an investigator initiates an investigation of Children's Playground, spend X actions: Children's Playground gets –X shroud for this investigation.

cards.flavor: The old, rickety equipment has been worn down by years of play. Several children's handprints have been stained into the woodwork with a deep red pigment.
cards.name: Children's Playground

cards.flavor:
It's a way in, but there aren't many 
places to hide in an open field.
cards.name: Sports Field
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if act 1c is in play: Each investigator at Sports Field must test [agility] (3). Each investigator who fails takes 2 horror.

cards.flavor:
An expanse of green sits behind the school, 
weeds pushing up through the once-pristine grass.
cards.name: Sports Field
Ritual Circle
cards.text: Haunted - Take 1 damage and 1 horror. Place 1 of your clues on Ritual Circle. Gain an action, which can only be used to investigate Ritual Circle. Each investigator at Ritual Circle is considered to be at a different copy of Ritual Circle.

cards.flavor:
Floating in this circle is a kaleidoscope of images, 
all of Mount Hollyoke, all slightly different variations 
on the night. You only see your own corpse in two or 
three of them, which you take as a good sign.
cards.name: Ritual Circle
Estravius Malone
cards.text: Hunter. While Estravius Malone is ready, investigators at his location get –2 [willpower]. Forced - When Estravius Malone attacks an investigator: That investigator draws the topmost [[Power]] or [[Paradox]] treachery in the encounter discard pile.

cards.name: Nexus of Aforgomon
cards.text:
Nexus of Aforgomon cannot leave play.
Each skill test printed on a [[Paradox]] treachery gets +1 difficulty.
Each [[Ritual]] location gets +2 shroud.

cards.name: The Colour's Spread
cards.text: The Colour's Spread cannot leave play. Forced - When a copy of The Myriad Gentleman attacks you: Damage and horror from this attack must be assigned to your [[Ally]] assets, if possible. Place any [[Ally]] assets defeated by this attack beneath the attacking enemy, as swarm cards.

cards.name: Assistance from the Lodge
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Take 1 horror. Then, choose one: -Deal 2 damage to an enemy. -Discover a clue from your location or a connecting location. -Heal 2 damage.

cards.flavor: "Is simple. The others have failed. I will not."
cards.name: Sheldon's Finest
cards.text:
Hunter. Retaliate.
While Sheldon's Finest are engaged with you, you get –1 [agility] and cannot move or be moved.

cards.flavor:
Wait, that's not what happens here. 
That's not what happens at all.
cards.name: Preserve Causality
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - If only one act deck is in play, Preserve Causality gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 damage. If you fail by 3 or more, add 1 [elder_thing] token to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign and remove Preserve Causality from the game.

cards.name: Temporal Instability
cards.text: Revelation - Add Temporal Instability to your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test: After this test ends, place 1 of your clues on your location, then move once towards Sports Field. Forced - At the end of the round: Test your lowest skill (2), then discard Temporal Instability.

cards.flavor: That looked like... No, never mind. Trick of the light.
cards.name: You Must Not Be Seen
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - If only one act deck is in play, You Must Not Be Seen gains surge. Otherwise, test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror. If you fail by 3 or more, you suffer 1 mental trauma and remove You Must Not Be Seen from the game.

cards.name: Time Runs Out
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the current act number.
[cultist]: –2. If you succeed and it is your turn, gain an action.
[tablet]: –4. If you fail and it is your turn, lose 1 action.
[elder_thing]: –5. If you fail, either exile a card from your hand or place 1 doom on your location.

cards.name: Time Runs Out
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is twice the current act number.
[cultist]: –3. If you succeed and it is your turn, gain an action.
[tablet]: –5. It is your turn and you did not succeed by at least 2, lose 1 action.
[elder_thing]: –8. If you fail, either exile a card from your hand or place 1 doom on your location.

cards.flavor: Standing on a plain of days and years, you can see Aforgomon looming above you. Time swirls and shifts as it moves its strange appendages, unwinding the threads that hold reality together.
cards.name: Outside of Time
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1[per_investigator] clues on 2 different random locations.

cards.name: Unmade
cards.text:
With Aforgomon's every gesture, more of reality falls apart.All times will be one, the Myriad said...
Randomly select a location that is not warded. Move any investigators and enemies at that location to a connecting location, and place that location underneath the agenda deck. If there are 2 or fewer locations in play, (→R1). Then, if there are any locations in play that are not warded, flip this agenda back to agenda 1a. Otherwise, advance to agenda 2a, and if it is act 2a then advance to act 2b.

cards.flavor:
Standing before you is... you. Or <n>a</n> you, at any rate. The maniacal grin and homicidal bloodlust is certainly new.
And above it all, Aforgomon still rages. He won't let your defiance stand.
cards.name: Familiar Adversaries
cards.text:
Locations with a resource on them are 'warded'.
[[Fate]] treacheries cannot be cancelled or discarded from play, except by abilities printed on them.

cards.name: A Broken Eternity
cards.text:
The dam breaks. The rage of Aforgomon pours forth. Reality is ravaged in the blink of an eye.
(→R1).

cards.flavor: This time, you have some knowledge of how this realm, this time-outside-of-time works. You're not caught, tossed around by the timestream like dust in the wind. Still, with a malevolent god gazing down at you with its many eyes, you have to wonder: What can you possibly do here?
cards.name: Out of Your Depth
cards.text: Locations with a resource on them are 'warded'.

cards.name: Weaving Fate
cards.text: With some experimentation, you find you can manipulate the threads of this reality, to a limited extent. Perhaps, if you study what Aforgomon is doing, you can find a way to counter it.

cards.name: Preservation
cards.text: Locations with a resource on them are 'warded'. [action] Investigators at your location spend 2[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remove each doom from your location. Place 1 resource on your location. (Group limit once per game at each location.) Objective - At the end of the round, if all locations are warded, advance.

cards.name: A Familiar Face
cards.text:
Every fibre of your body wants to collapse, to sink to the ground and never get up. But you've done what you can: the landscape around you is made up of pools of unmade time, but dotted around it are bastions you've weaved, keeping reality together. They're holding, at least for now. Aforgomon screams in defiance, a maddening sound unlike any earthly creature. It reaches into the timestream, pulling forth figures to stand against you. Very familiar figures...
Remove all doom from play. If it is agenda 1a, advance to agenda 2a. Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove all clues from each location. Put the set-aside The Past, The Present and The Future locations into play. Put the set-aside Yourself enemy next to the agenda deck. Each investigator puts the top card of their deck facedown in their threat area, as a copy of Yourself. 'You' on each copy of Yourself refers to the owner of the card.

cards.flavor: Much of the timeline lies broken before you. It will need rebuilding. And maybe—possibly—you can bind Aforgomon with new realities, keeping all of this from happening again.
cards.name: Against a God
cards.text: Objective - At the end of the round, investigators may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

cards.name: One Last Offensive
cards.text: Your bindings begin to do their work, taking hold of Aforgomon. Failing to shake them off, it instead turns to strike frantically at their weak point: you.

cards.name: Weathering the Storm
cards.text: Skip the 'Place 1 doom on the current agenda' step of the Mythos phase. Forced - When the 'draw encounter cards' step of the mythos phase begins: The lead investigator must randomly choose one of the locations beneath the agenda deck, flip it, and resolve its text. Objective - After checking the doom threshold, if each of the following is true, advance: -There are no locations beneath the agenda deck. -There are no clues on [[Paradox]] locations. -There are no [[Servitor]] enemies in play.

cards.name: The Key in the Lock
cards.text:
It's done. Reality is forged anew, with Aforgomon trapped within its bonds.
(→R2).

cards.name: Fulcrum of Possibility
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, either move to any other location, or move another investigator to this location.

cards.name: Fulcrum of Possibility
cards.text: Revelation - Put Fulcrum of Possibility into play. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are any clues on this location: In player order, each investigator draws the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Days That Never Were
cards.text: [action] Take 1 mental trauma and exile a card in your hand of level 1 or higher: Search your collection for a non-exceptional player card of level at most X, where X is the level of the exiled card. Add that card to your hand. (Limit once per game.)

cards.name: Days That Never Were
cards.text: Revelation - Put Days That Never Were into play. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are any clues on this location: Place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator at this location must either take 2 direct horror or exile a card in their hand of level 1 or higher.

cards.name: Dawn of the Universe
cards.text: [reaction] After you enter Dawn of the Universe: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a card and draw it. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per round.) Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at Dawn of the Universe: Take 1 damage and 1 physical trauma. Place 1 clue on Dawn of the Universe.

cards.name: Dawn of the Universe
cards.text: Revelation - Put Dawn of the Universe into play. Forced - After you enter Dawn of the Universe: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a weakness and draw it. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are any clues on this location: Place 1 doom on the current agenda. Each investigator at this location must move to a connecting location.

cards.name: Dawn of the Universe
cards.text: [reaction] After you enter Dawn of the Universe: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a card and draw it. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per round.) Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at Dawn of the Universe: Take 1 damage and 1 physical trauma. Place 1 clue on Dawn of the Universe.

cards.name: Dawn of the Universe
cards.text: Revelation - Put Dawn of the Universe into play. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Dawn of the Universe: Return an asset you control to your hand. If that asset has uses, take X damage or X horror, where X is the difference between the listed number of uses and the number of uses remaining on the card. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are any clues on this location: Place 1 doom on the current agenda.

cards.name: The Past
cards.text: Forced - At the start of your turn: Shuffle a random card from your hand into your deck. Add a random non-weakness card from your discard pile to your hand. [action][action]: You bring together the threads of the past and present, resetting your encounter with Aforgomon to its beginning. →R3. (Max once per campaign.)

cards.flavor: What was...
cards.name: The Past
The Present
cards.text: [free]: If you have yet to take your turn this round: Take an action as if it were your turn. This action counts toward the number of actions you can take each turn. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor: ...what is...
cards.name: The Present
The Future
cards.text: Forced - At the start of your turn: Choose and discard a card from your hand. Draw a card.

cards.flavor: ...and what will be.
cards.name: The Future
Yourself
cards.text: Prey - You only. Hunter. This enemy's fight value is equal to your base [combat]. This enemy's evade value is equal to your base [agility]. If you are a Guardian, this enemy gets +2 health. If you are a Seeker, this enemy gets +1 horror value. If you are a Rogue, this enemy gains alert. If you are a Mystic, place 1 doom on this enemy. If you are a Survivor, this enemy gets +1 damage value.

cards.flavor: Aforgomon has always been, and always will be, and his thralls are all who have ever existed.
cards.name: Ageless Watchers
cards.text: Hunter. Swarming 1. Spawn - Furthest empty location. (If no locations are empty, Ageless Watchers gains surge.) Forced - After an event is played at any location: Place that card beneath Ageless Watchers, as a swarm card.

cards.name: Blessed of Aforgomon
cards.text: Forced - When Blessed of Aforgomon would spawn at any location: Put Blessed of Aforgomon into play next to the agenda deck instead. You may fight or evade Blessed of Aforgomon as if it were at your location (it is not engaged with you). While Blessed of Aforgomon is ready, each investigator must take one fewer action during each of their turns.

cards.name: Entropic Shade
cards.text: Alert. Hunter. Forced - When an ability printed on an asset deals damage to Entropic Shade, if that asset has no copy of Accelerated Decay attached: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Accelerated Decay and attach it to that asset. Shuffle the encounter deck.

cards.name: Fateweaver
cards.text: Spawn - Nearest unwarded empty location. Aloof. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: If Fateweaver is at an unwarded location, place 1 doom on Fateweaver's location. Otherwise, move Fateweaver once towards the nearest unwarded location.

cards.flavor: I exist, I have life, and form. So why do I feel so... faded?
cards.name: Am I... Real?
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - If "your existence is waning", test [willpower] (6). For each point you fail by, reveal the top card of your deck, drawing each revealed weakness and exiling each other revealed card. If you fail by 3 or more, also take 1 direct horror and 1 mental trauma.

cards.flavor: Let's see how long it takes to unmake you...
cards.name: Grandfather Paradox
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you are at a [[Past]] location, this test gets +2 difficulty. If you fail, take 2 horror and remember that "your existence is waning."

cards.name: Syzygy
cards.text: Revelation - Each investigator at a [[Past]] location loses 1 action. Each investigator at a [[Present]] location takes 1 damage and 1 horror. Each investigator at a [[Future]] location gains 1 action and draws the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.name: The Chain of Aforgomon
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). If you fail, place 1 doom on your location, then take 1 damage for each point you failed by.

cards.name: Watch You Break
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - Choose one: -Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This can cause the current agenda to advance. -Search your collection for a random basic [[Pact]] or [[Madness]] weakness and draw it.

cards.name: Chronophage
cards.text: Alert. Hunter. Forced - After Chronophage attacks you: Lose an action.

cards.name: Weight of the Centuries
cards.text: Revelation - Put Weight of the Centuries into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (X), where X is the number of actions you performed this turn. For each point you failed by, take 1 damage. Discard Weight of the Centuries.

cards.name: The Myriad Gentleman
cards.text: Hunter. Swarming 1. The Myriad Gentleman gets +1 fight for each [[Myriad]] swarm card at his location (to a maximum of +3). Forced - After the host Myriad Gentleman is defeated: Discard 1 swarm card from each other [[Myriad]] host card in play.

cards.name: Omnipresence
cards.text: Revelation - If there are no empty locations in play, Omnipresence gains surge. Otherwise, attach to an empty location without a copy of Omnipresence attached. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for each copy of Omnipresence and draw them. [free]: Discard Omnipresence. Forced - After the agenda advances: Discard Omnipresence and place 1 doom on the current agenda.

cards.name: Front Hallway
cards.text: Haunted – If the Hound of Unmaking is in play and undamaged, place 1 damage on it

cards.flavor:
The school's front entrance is undoubtedly 
guarded, but should hopefully lead you straight 
to the heart of the Myriad's plot.
cards.name: Front Hallway
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter Front Hallway, investigators at Children's Playground must spend 3[per_investigator] clues as a group.

cards.name: Rear Corridors
cards.text: Enemies in the Rear Corridors gain massive and lose aloof.

cards.flavor:
A small side door allows access to the back of 
the school, via a narrow, winding corridor. 
Perhaps it'll be a less conspicuous method of access?
cards.name: Rear Corridors
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter Rear Corridors, investigators at Side Building must spend 3[per_investigator] clues as a group.

cards.name: Ritual Circle
cards.text: Haunted – Suspend your current turn and remove your investigator from the game. At the start of the next investigator phase, return your investigator to this location and resume the current turn. Investigators at this location cannot willingly end their turn while they have actions remaining.

cards.flavor:
Hooded acolytes skitter around this circle, 
scratching at the ever-twisting runes on its perimeter. Within, images twist and morph; Arkham aflame, 
a rising tide, a land with two suns, a murky brown rock floating in space, and endless, boundless nothingness.
cards.name: Ritual Circle
Ritual Circle
cards.text: Haunted – Move to Front Gates. Forced - When an investigator at this location would draw cards, gain resources or gain actions from a player card effect: Cancel that aspect. Then, perform the opposite of that aspect (discard cards, lose resources, or lose actions, respectively). Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at Ritual Circle heals 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.flavor:
Time doesn't seem to be working properly near this circle. Well, time isn't working properly anywhere in this damned building, but here it seems to be running backwards. 
A dozen figures try to carve additional runes 
around the circle's outer layers, but half of 
them only manage to un-draw existing symbols.
cards.name: Ritual Circle
Cafeteria
cards.text: Haunted – Lose all remaining actions and end your turn. [action][action]: Investigate. If you fail, do not trigger this location's haunted ability.

cards.flavor:
A mound of chairs, tables and miscellany fills 
the school's cafeteria. Among all the junk, presumably tossed out of other rooms to make space, perhaps 
you can find some useful information?
cards.name: Cafeteria
Classroom
cards.text: Haunted – End your turn. Forced - At the start of the mythos phase: Each investigator at this location draws the top card of the encounter deck, in player order.

cards.flavor:
A series of classrooms have been commandeered by 
the Myriad. Though the main ritual seems to be through 
the warded door at the corridor's end, perhaps these 
secondary chambers will hold something you can use.
cards.name: Classroom
Classroom
cards.text: Haunted – Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Criminal]] enemy and draw it. While you are investigating Classroom, it gets –2 shroud for each standard action you have remaining.

cards.flavor:
A series of classrooms have been commandeered by 
the Myriad. Though the main ritual seems to be through 
the warded door at the corridor's end, perhaps these 
secondary chambers will hold something you can use.
cards.name: Classroom

cards.flavor:
Maybe a failed experiment, maybe some kind 
of power source, this room is dominated by 
a swirling vortex of ethereal energy.
cards.name: Classroom
cards.text: Haunted – For each standard action you have remaining, either lose 1 action or take 1 direct damage.

cards.flavor:
A series of classrooms have been commandeered by 
the Myriad. Though the main ritual seems to be through 
the warded door at the corridor's end, perhaps these 
secondary chambers will hold something you can use.
cards.name: Classroom
Principal's Office
cards.text: Haunted – For each action you have completed this turn, take 1 horror or choose and discard a card from your hand. Principal's Office gets +1 shroud for each action you have completed this turn.

cards.flavor:
An aura of hopelessness hangs over the small 
corner office. Something supernatural lurks within, breaking itself against your will.
cards.name: Principal's Office
Backfire
cards.text:
The barrier begins to pulse, the power coiled within it exploding outwards. You feel spring and winter surge through you, energy and time and heat and cold and day and night, leaving you drained and confused as the energy dissipates into the walls. When the dust settles, the way is clear. So that's something.
In your Campaign Log, record that the investigators unleashed chaos. Next to this, record the time. Shuffle each set-aside copy of Unleashed Chaos into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. The investigator who flipped this card takes 1 physical trauma, and shuffles the set-aside Unstable Energies into their deck, adding it to their deck for the remainder of the campaign. Advance the act. Then, remove this card from the game.

cards.name: Unstable Warding
cards.text: [action] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Test [willpower] or [combat] (1[per_investigator]). If you succeed, add 1 resource to Unstable Warding. If you fail, place 1 horror on Unstable Warning. Then, if Unstable Warding has no remaining sanity, flip it and resolve its text.

cards.name: Hound of Unmaking
cards.text: Massive. Retaliate. Forced - When Hound of Unmaking attacks you during the enemy phase: Either discard an asset you control or the attack deals you +2 damage. Forced - At the end of the round: Heal 1 damage from Hound of Unmaking.

cards.name: The Myriad Gentleman
cards.text: Alert. Retaliate. The Myriad Gentleman cannot move to a non-[[Ritual]] location. Forced - After The Myriad Gentleman attacks you: Move once towards the nearest [[Exterior]] location.

cards.name: Stirring Titan
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - If Hound of Unmaking is in play and undamaged, deal 1 damage to it.

cards.name: Unstable Energies
cards.text: Fight. Add your [willpower] to your skill value for this attack. This attack deals +2 damage. Forced - If Unstable Energies is in your hand at the end of your turn: Reveal it and take 1 damage.

cards.name: Beckoning of Oblivion
cards.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] or [willpower] (X), where X is the number of standard actions you have. For each point you fail by, either lose 1 action or take 1 direct horror.

cards.flavor:
"We have to stop this madness, before it's—
We have to stop this madness, before—
We have to stop this madness—
We have to stop this—"
cards.name: Time Loop
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, choose one of: fight, move, evade, investigate, play, draw, or resource. You can only perform actions of the chosen type this round.

cards.name: Time Reshaped
cards.text:
Surge.
Choose one:
-<emsp>Lose 1 action. You get +1 skill value during  skill tests until the end of the round.
-<emsp>Gain 1 action. You get –1 skill value during skill tests until the end of the round.

cards.name: Time's Ebb
cards.text: Revelation - Put Time's Ebb into play in your threat area. Forced - At the start of the mythos phase: You may choose an investigator. If you do not, lose an action. If you do, discard Time's Ebb, and the next time the chosen investigator draws an encounter card, they then draw the top two cards of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Time's Surge
cards.text: Revelation - Draw the top three cards of the encounter deck. For each copy of Time's Ebb drawn this way, discard it and draw the top card of the encounter deck. Then, put Time's Surge into play in your threat area. [reaction] When an investigator would draw the top card of the encounter deck, discard Time's Surge: That investigator gains an action instead.

cards.name: Night Black as Pitch
cards.text: Revelation - Put Night Black As Pitch into play next to the agenda deck. Each location gets +1 shroud. Each enemy gets +1 evade. Increase all horror taken by 1. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Night Black as Pitch.

cards.name: Lost in the Dark
cards.text: Revelation - Put Lost in the Dark into play in your threat area. As an additional cost to move, test [willpower] or [agility] (3). If you fail, either take 2 horror or cancel the effects of the move. Forced - At the end the round: Discard Lost in the Dark.

cards.name: Reality Undone
cards.text:
Each investigator tests [willpower] (3). Each investigator who fails must choose a different option:
-<emsp>Take 3 damage.
-<emsp>Take 3 horror.
-<emsp>Discard an asset you control.
-<emsp>Draw the top two cards of the encounter      deck.

cards.name: Uneven Acceleration
cards.text: Revelation - Each investigator must choose one: -Lose an action. -Gain an action. Draw the top card of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Rewritten Existence
cards.text: Revelation - Put Rewritten Existence into play in your threat area. When you would test [combat], instead test [intellect], and vice versa. When you would test [willpower], instead test [agility], and vice versa. Forced - At the end of the round: Test any skill (3). If you succeed, discard Rewritten Existence.

cards.name: Aspects of Infinity
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Choose two. Perform the first part of one and the second part of the other: -Take 2 damage. / Heal 2 damage. -Take 2 horror. / Heal 2 horror. -Lose 2 actions. / Gain 2 actions. -Draw the top card of the encounter deck. / This card loses surge.

cards.name: Out of Phase
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, put Out of Phase into play in your threat area. If you fail by 3 or more, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and spawn it engaged with you. You cannot interact with cards in other investigators' threat areas, and vice versa. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Out of Phase.

cards.name: Skills of Another Life
cards.text: Revelation - Discard 2 random cards from your hand. Search the top three cards of another investigator's deck for a non-weakness, non-signature card and draw it. Shuffle the searched deck.

cards.name: Hired Thugs
cards.text:
Hunter. Retaliate.
While Hired Thugs are engaged with you, you get –1 [agility].

cards.name: Myriad Assassin
cards.text: Alert. Hunter. Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, Myriad Assassin makes an immediate attack against you.

cards.flavor: "Some very powerful people have decided you need to be destroyed, and honey, we're them."
cards.name: Irregulars
cards.text: Hunter. Forced - After the Irregulars enter play: They get +2 fight, +2 evade and +1 horror until the end of the round. Forced - After the Irregulars attack you: Shuffle them into the top 2[per_investigator] cards of the encounter deck.

cards.name: Rigged to Blow
cards.text:
Peril.
You must decide (choose one):
-<emsp>Test [agility] (2). If you succeed, you may move one investigator at your location to a connecting location.
-<emsp>Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, you may move each  investigator at your location to a connecting location.
Then, each investigator at the location where this card   was drawn takes 2 damage.

cards.name: Unleashed Chaos (Acceleration)
cards.text: Revelation - Draw the top card of the encounter deck. If it is an enemy, attach Unleashed Chaos (Acceleration) to it. Otherwise, gain 1 action and Unleashed Chaos (Acceleration) gains surge. Forced - After attached enemy attacks: Reveal a chaos token. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing] or [auto_fail] is revealed, the attached enemy attacks again. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Unleashed Chaos (Proliferation)
cards.text: Revelation - Draw a card and gain a resource. Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Until Unleashed Chaos (Proliferation) leaves play, treat it as an exact copy of the drawn card and resolve it as if you had just drawn it.

cards.name: Unleashed Chaos (Mutation)
cards.text: Revelation - Draw the top card of the encounter deck and attach Unleashed Chaos (Mutation) to it. When you would succeed at a skill test while resolving an ability on the attached card, or while attacking or evading the attached enemy: Reveal and resolve an additional chaos token. (Limit once per test.)

cards.name: Memories Fade to Dust
cards.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (3). For each point you fail by, you must either (choose one): -Place one of your clues on your location. -Discard a random card from your hand. -Take 1 horror.

cards.name: Accelerated Decay
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Accelerated Decay to an asset you control. (If you control no assets, take 2 damage.) [free]: Discard attached asset. Forced - After you reveal a [skull] token during a skill test: Place 1 resource on Accelerated Decay, then take 1 damage for each resource on Accelerated Decay.

cards.name: The End of All Things
cards.text:
As an additional cost to move to The End of All Things, exile a non-weakness asset you control.
[action] Exile a non-weakness asset you control: Gain 2 clues from the token pool. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Oblivion
cards.text: Spawn - The Future. Hunter. Massive. The End of All Things cannot be defeated. For each 1[per_investigator] damage on The End of All Things, it gets –1 damage value and –1 horror value. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: If The End of All Things is ready, it heals 1[per_investigator] damage. Otherwise, ready The End of All Things.

cards.name: What Could Be
cards.text: [action]: Until the end of the round, What Could Be is connected to each other location, and vice versa. Investigators at any location can activate this ability.

cards.name: Tide of Possibility
cards.text:
In countless times and places, a myriad of cruel injustices have befell kings and paupers, the kind and the cruel, rogues and saints and vagabonds. Now, they are yours.
The lead investigator draws the top 2[per_investigator] cards of the encounter deck, one at a time. If they are defeated by a card drawn this way, the new lead investigator draws the remainder of these cards. Remove What Could Be from the game.

cards.name: Secrets Long Forgotten
cards.text: Forced - After you successfully investigate Secrets Long Forgotten: Either draw a card, or take 1 horror and search your collection for a level 0 skill card, adding that card to your hand.

cards.name: Truth
cards.text: Spawn - The Past. Alert. Hunter. Forced - After Secrets Long Forgotten attacks you: Search the collection for a random basic [[Madness]] weakness and draw it. Place 1 doom on the current agenda.

cards.name: Days That Never Were
cards.text: [action] Take 1 mental trauma and exile a card in your hand of level 1 or higher: Search your collection for a non-exceptional player card of level at most X, where X is the level of the exiled card. Add that card to your hand. (Limit once per game.)

cards.name: Unwritten Existence
cards.text: Revelation - The lead investigator must decide (choose one): -Put this card into play in your threat area. -Remove this card from the game. Place 2 doom on the current agenda. This effect may cause the current agenda to advance. Your existence is waning. Forced - At the end of your turn: Exile the top 1[per_investigator] cards of your deck. Take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.

cards.name: Secrets Long Forgotten
cards.text: Forced - After you successfully investigate Secrets Long Forgotten: Either draw a card, or take 1 horror and search your collection for a level 0 skill card, adding that card to your hand.

cards.name: Eternity's Sentinel
cards.subname: He's Been Waiting For So Long
cards.text: Spawn - Furthest location from all investigators. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Place 1 doom on the current agenda. If the investigators slew their strange observer,Secrets Long Forgotten gets +2 fight, +1 damage and +1 horror.

cards.name: Today, a Thousand Times
cards.text: Forced - After a skill test is performed at this location: Perform that test again. (Limit once per phase.)

cards.name: A Thousand Avenues of Attack
cards.text:
Chronos gazes upon the timelines with his three eyes. From each, he takes note of anomalies, potential threats, aberrations he might be able to use. Now, he seeks these out, plucking them from their realities and launching them at you.
In player order, each investigator draws the top three cards of the encounter deck, one at a time. Remove Today, a Thousand Times from the game.

cards.name: What Could Never Be
cards.text: This location cannot be investigated.

cards.name: Erasure
cards.text:
You are being changed. Your timeline is being unwritten. Your ancestry, your his tory, the things th at make you, y ou. Gone
Each investigator tests [willpower] (3), [intellect] (3), [combat] (3) and [agility] (3), in any order. If "your existence is waning", each of these tests gets +1 difficulty for you. Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror for each of these tests that they fail. Each investigator that fails at least three of these tests is killed. Remove What Could Never Be from the game.

cards.name: What Could Never Be
cards.text: This location cannot be investigated.

cards.name: Shattering Paradox
cards.text:
The wards you've built are strong, but Aforgomon's power knows no earthly bounds. It attacks your wards from the inside, dismantling the protection you've laid over your reality.
One investigator tests [willpower] (5). One investigator tests [intellect] (5). One investigator tests [willpower]+[intellect] (8). For each of these tests that is failed, the performing investigator must choose a different option: -Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This can cause the current agenda to advance. -Choose a random warded location in play, and place it beneath the agenda deck. -The performing investigator takes 6 horror. Remove What Could Never Be from the game.

cards.name: Today, a Thousand Times
cards.text: Forced - After a skill test is performed at this location: Perform that test again. (Limit once per phase.)

cards.name: A Thousand Paths to Victory
cards.text:
Chronos gazes upon the timelines with his three eyes. With the knowledge he has, the multitude of alternate existences he sees and manipulates, how can you possibly hope to stop him? You can't. You just can't.
Place 1 doom on the current agenda. Remove Today, a Thousand Times from the game.

cards.name: What Could Be
cards.text: [action]: Until the end of the round, What Could Be is connected to each other location, and vice versa. Investigators at any location can activate this ability.

cards.name: Aged a Thousand Years
cards.text: Revelation - The investigator with the highest total base [combat] and [agility] puts this card into play in their threat area. Set the base value of your [combat] and [agility] to 1. Forced - At the start of the investigator phase: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Spawn that enemy engaged with you. [action]: Place 1 doom on the current agenda. Remove Aged a Thousand Years from the game.

cards.name: Fulcrum of Possibility
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, either move to any other location, or move another investigator to this location.

cards.name: The Myriad
cards.text: Spawn - The Present. Massive. Swarming 2[per_investigator]. Forced - When Fulcrum of Possibility attacks during the enemy phase: Resolve its attack against one investigator at its location (instead of against each investigator). Attacks from copies of Fulcrum of Possibility must be split as evenly as possible between each investigator at its location.

cards.name: The End of All Things
cards.text:
As an additional cost to move to The End of All Things, exile a non-weakness asset you control.
[action] Exile a non-weakness asset you control: Gain 2 clues from the token pool. (Limit once per round.)

cards.name: Oblivion Beckons
cards.text:
At the end of the universe is nothing, an endless, bitter blackness that consumes everything it touches. Even that, as terrible as it began, bears the marks of Aforgomon's interference, as it twists and wends towards you, seeking your end at the dark god's behest.
Each investigator tests [combat] (4). Each investigator who fails takes 1 damage for each point they failed by. Each investigator tests [willpower] (4). Each investigator who fails takes 1 horror for each point they failed by. Each investigator whose "existence is waning" tests [agility] (4). Each investigator who fails chooses and exiles a card from their hand for each point they failed by. Remove The End of All Things from the game.
